Description  The Opportunity ?? Turn data into insights  The Marketing Data Analyst is responsible for helping Gen unleash the potential of its marketing data. Their role is to own, manage and analyze Gen??s marketing data to create valuable insights that can be used to optimize performance.  The Marketing Data Analyst will support the ongoing transformation of the marketing function and our drive for predictable multi-channel lead generation. Central to the success of this role is a deep understanding of marketing analytics and the ability to advise and guide other members of the marketing domain on the best course of action to optimize performance.  Core responsibilities include:  Developing insights for continuous improvement: Analyze and interpret data using a range of analysis and presentation tools and make recommendations for actions to optimize marketing performance. Measurement: Development of relevant metrics and KPIs to determine ongoing performance of marketing and lead generation activities. Reporting: Creation of marketing dashboards and reporting framework and ownership of ongoing reporting activities to monitor marketing performance. Data stewardship: Ownership of all marketing and CRM data ensuring good data management practices and compliance with GDPR and other regional legislation.  Collaboration: Collaborate closely with colleagues in the marketing and sales domains and the multidisciplinary teams within Gen to ensure marketing insights are used to drive continuous improvement across the buyer journey.  Key Deliverables  Analysis and interpretation of marketing data from multiple sources to create insights that optimize marketing performance ?? with the primary objective of optimizing lead generation activities and increasing the number of Marketing Qualified Leads. Help Gen improve its understanding of how customers and prospects interact with the business via multiple channels to optimize buyer journeys. Create a real-time dashboard and regular reporting system that helps the marketing domain and other internal stakeholders better understand prospect and customer paths to purchase. Be the custodian of Gen??s marketing data. Drive excellent data management practices to ensure data quality and that Gen??s data complies with all relevant regional guidelines and legislations. Qualifications  Key Relationships, Collaborations and Connections  This role reports to the Digital Marketing Manager and will be a key member of the growing marketing team. They will also be expected to build close relationships with colleagues from the Gen Sales and CX domains.  They will also collaborate closely with digital marketing colleagues in Arcadis core  What We Are Looking For  The ideal candidate will have a passion for data and insights. We??re looking for someone highly analytical - but a head for numbers isn??t quite enough. The successful candidate will also be able to see the people behind the data ?? and have a knack for using data to understand human behaviors and drive continuous improvement. It would be highly advantageous if their experience has been gained in a fast moving SaaS business ?? where the focus is on driving a healthy and predictable lead generation engine.  They will have a proven track record in analyzing, visualizing and reporting on data to create highly valuable insights and will need to feel comfortable advising others in the organization on where changes are needed based on their findings.  Beyond that we are looking for someone who possesses:  A talent for visualizing data and communicating findings in an easy-to-understand way A commercial mindset to drive value from insights A brilliant combination of analytical skills and customer insights to really ??get under the skin?? of what the data is saying to understand paths to purchase In-depth understanding of relevant analytical, reporting, visualization and presentation tools to allow clear communication of findings and recommendations A thirst for learning ?? constantly keeping updated on new trends, software and processes to enhance Gen??s digital marketing approach. Experience using Hubspot CRM would be highly advantageous

ability to plan, prioritize and set goals. As the Business Analytics Manager you will have the opportunity to help lead the operations in SEA. You will play a vital role in all aspects of the business, from creating the best possible exchange through best in-field operations, to launching new product offerings in your country. You will be expected to help with all areas of the business, from administrative support, hiring, strategic thinking and general problem solving.  Location for this role is flexible. Helping to coordinate local key marketing activities, such as developing new partnerships and organizing key events. Represent Binance in the local events, media, and in communication with external stakeholders. Requirements: A minimum of 4 years of proven success in a similar role - leading operations/marketing, strong understanding of growth tactics, and a record of high-performing teams. Communication. Able to build and manage strong relationships with their team, cross-functional colleagues, and external partners. Entrepreneurship mentality. We are trying to change an entire industry and it will take time. Passion is what gets you excited to come into work every morning. Job Description  Business Analytics Manager  Quezon City  The Opportunity  The customer is the focus of everything we do, and millions of end users rely on our products daily. We believe in the value of empowering the Business Analytics Manager with the resources to solve critical problems for the future of our business, which is why we need you.  Manulifes Finance Operations is seeking for an individual, who is obsessed with delivering value, is forward-thinking, and passionate about using data to help drive insights and business decisions for senior leaders across a multinational organization.  What motivates you? You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile mindset and enable business outcomes You thrive in teams, and enjoy getting things done together You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone We are looking for someone with: 3-5 years years of experience building a team and managing direct reports with at least 5 years of experience in Data analytics, modeling, data management or a related field. Experience with other Business intelligence and visualization tools (Tableau, QlikView, Power BI) Strong leadership, diplomatic and motivational skills including the ability to lead up, across and down multiple business and technology organizations Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment demonstrating teamwork, innovation, and excellence Build and maintain relationships by engaging business leaders to establish credibility, solve problems, build consensus and achieve objectives Experience leading, motivating and managing various project and program team sizes, including internal and external resources, while holding the team accountable for performance Interpersonal skills to influence and spur change, facilitate and enhance performance within a cross-functional environment Able to clearly articulate concepts to people with varying technical background Listening and analytical skills to objectively evaluate and escalate complex project risks and issues A high degree of organizational skills, ability to set priorities, manage multiple demands and the ability to complete tasks under strict timelines is required. Nice to Haves: Preferably Managers specializing in Analytics, Process Excellence and Business Knowledge. Degree in math, statistics, computer science, economics and other quantitative disciplines with strong business and finance background. Experience with SQL queries will be helpful. On the job you will: Lead the business analytics projects with internal stakeholders to define business requirements; identify and recommend potential data sources and solutions; and develop executive management reports, analyses, and/or data visualizations that answer the problem. Collaborate with key operational and functional stakeholders across the company to understand high-level strategy and roadmaps and translate those to tactical analytics projects Perform stakeholder management including; managing customer expectations for project deliverables, status meetings, and change proposals Provide business insights to uncover growth and expense levers (revenue and cost), identify, evaluate and seize opportunities to improve business value. Develop analytically rich solutions that help us both understand what has happened in the past, and help us predict what will happen in the future. Develop Statement of Work proposals for new clients that will address their requirements and needs for business insights. Identify and design processes that ensure data integrity and accuracy across the entire organization Create solutions and efficiencies in improving the data process from data capture, scrubbing, validation, and enrichment Develop a strong understanding of our data platform (know where and how data is stored and accessed) Ensure adherence to data management/data governance regulations and policies. Team management including; managing development team task assignments and holding team members accountable for commitments, coaching, mentoring, regular employee reviews and supervising project and program team Consult with MBPS Finance management on business planning, direction, and identification of opportunities for team growth and development Lead the regular business reviews and produce dashboard and metrics reports detailing the teams performance (productivity, utilization, and attendance), challenges and areas for improvement. Ensure that all Service Level Agreements and Statement of Work (SOW) between MBPS and Business Unit comply with the standards and are met at all times Our commitment to you Our mission; to be a part of making Decisions Easier and Lives Better A leadership team dedicated to your growth and success A bold ambition and set of goals to be a leader in driving transformation in our industry Our best. Every day. Learn more about opportunities with us at jobs.manulife.com  If you are ready to unleash your potential, its time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.   About Manulife  Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2019, we had more than 35,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 30 million customers. As of March 31, 2020, we had $1.2 trillion (US$0.8 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $30.4 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.  Manulife is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention and advancement and we administer all of our practices and programs based on qualification and performance and without discrimination on any protected ground. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request any accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Job Description: Market Intelligence (MI) provides critical data and insight to global asset managers, insurance companies and distributors to help them make informed, strategic decisions to manage and grow their business. Through its combination of proprietary and integrated datasets, in-depth global research and trusted executive engagement, ISS MI delivers solutions for market sizing, competitor benchmarking, product strategy and opportunity identification across a wide range of financial products including funds, annuities, insurance, mortgages, and other instruments. The ISS MI solutions include the industry-leading data platforms Simfund, BrightScope, Local Market Share, and Financial Clarity, as well a full collection of global research and analytics services including Investor Economics, Market Metrics, and Plan for Life.  Job Overview:  The Enterprise Analyst team works with our product clients to obtain, clean, and aggregate various data platforms into our data system. The Enterprise Analyst will help manage all inbound and outbound data feeds, as well as work with the team to ensure the quality and accuracy of the data deliverables. The team assesses and analyzes this data to provide actionable business intelligence for our clients. Through the use of SQL, Excel, and other technology tools, the analyst will complete client requests in a timely manner and provide meaningful analysis about patterns and trends in the industry. The Enterprise Data Analyst also works closely with the Development, Product, and Client Engagement team to ensure data needs are met and delivered in a timely manner. Job Description: Senior Data Engineer  The Enterprise Data Management and Analytics (EDMA) team at SiteMinder is the central BI and Analytics team catering to all analytical needs across the company.  As the Senior Data Engineer you will play an important role as part of the core data engineering team responsible for the entire BI infrastructure using various AWS data stack technologies and Apache Airflow.  Who we are:  Ever booked hotel accommodation on Booking.com, Expedia or TripAdvisor? Chances are, you??ve used SiteMinder. Our goal is to liberate hoteliers with technology that makes a world of difference, and we do that by helping them find and acquire guests online.  We are the world??s leading guest acquisition platform for hotels, supporting 35,000 hotels in 160 countries to generate more than 87 million reservations on our platform each year.  We??re not like other tech companies  It's rare that a global tech company is headquartered in Australia, not to mention one that??s backed by the same Silicon Valley investor as Facebook, Netflix and Expedia. How??s that for good company?  We pioneered a SaaS model for hotels in 2006, and 13 years on, competition is tough but we work hard to call ourselves the world??s leading guest acquisition platform for hotels. So far, we have 35,000 hotel customers in 160 countries, and we??re on a mission to make a world of difference to 60,000 hotels by 2022! As Senior Data Engineer, your primary responsibilities will include: Build and maintain core data architecture components as part of the enterprise data architecture enhancements Analyse and optimise the existing Data architecture using best practices Identify, analyse and integrate various data source systems being used across the organisation Ensure existing data architecture works optimally and undertake regular maintenance tasks The ideal candidate will possess: 6+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role with experience in at least 1 complete cloud implementation project Preferably have experience in designing and developing complex workflows on workflow management tools like Airflow, AWS data pipeline or similar Experience in developing Enterprise data architecture using the latest Big Data technologies preferably Open Source Preferably have experience in solution development using Kinesis, Kafka or similar alternatives to handle data streaming data sets for at least 1 project Previous experience working within AWS data services such as Glue, EMR, Kinesis, Redshift, Athena, Aurora Experience in developing customised integration layers in Python through REST and SOAP API architectures is a plus! Ability to understand, design, write and debug complex code in Python, Spark and SQL Experience in Tableau server management and optimisation on Cloud server is an advantage How to apply  Does this job sound like you? If yes, we'd love for you to be part of our team! Please send a copy of your resume and our Talent Acquisition team will be in touch.  We encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply  Why join SiteMinder  At SiteMinder, you??ll do the best work of your career. We??re the trailblazers of our industry and our enemy is closed thinking, so you??ll have the chance to be creative and question the status quo. Every day, you??ll have new problems to solve - and meet new people to learn from. We continue to grow rapidly and we??re committed to supporting the learning you need as you grow with us.

Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries. In January 2018, we raised one of the largest Series C rounds ever in Southeast Asia and are well-positioned for our next phase of rapid growth.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  The Business Intelligence team arms Ninja Van across South East Asia with the means to make data-informed decisions at every turn. This includes BI tooling and infrastructure as well as thoughtful analysis. As Data Analytics Manager for PH, you??ll work closely with each part of the business, spanning across Operations (Delivery, Sort, First Mile, Last Mile, Middle Mile) and Demand (Sales, Marketing, CS). Take dashboard requirements and transfer into rapidly developed prototypes and working solutions. Remain detail-oriented while working across a wide variety of projects. Collaborate with different units in terms of data and table structures to optimize for KPI reporting. Manage relationships, deliverables and expectations with your business partners. Develop and implement Ninja Van??s strategy, ensuring the company delivers delight one parcel at a time. Experience in business intelligence software (Tableau, Looker, Qlikview, MicroStrategy) and ETL software. Knowledge of data warehouse technical architecture, infrastructure components, ETL and reporting/analytic tools and environments. Expert in data extraction using SQL. Strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking paired with Intellectual curiosity and aptitude in picking up new technical skills. Ability to execute fast-paced and dynamic projects in a highly organized manner on a tight schedule. Work collaboratively across different functions and effectively influence senior business partners. Degree in Computer Science, IT, Math, Physics, Statistics, Engineering or quantitative field. Proficient with SQL(Postgres, MySQL, Redshift, Snowflake), Python3+ years of relevant work experience in analytics, data engineering, business intelligence or related field. Expert knowledge of web optimization, heat mapping and multivariate A/B testing software such as VWO, Crazy Egg, HotJar, Optimizely, etc. Experience with attribution modeling methodologies. Ability to concurrently manage competing priorities while maintaining high standards of quality and attention to detail. About Manulife  Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2019, we had more than 35,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 30 million customers. As of December 31, 2019, we had $1.2 trillion (US$0.9 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $29.7 billion in payments to our customers.  Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 100 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.  Manulife is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention and advancement and we administer all of our practices and programs based on qualification and performance and without discrimination on any protected ground.  It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request any accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Job Title Analytic Consultant 3  15-Oct-2020  Auto req ID 54906BR  Market Job Title/Designation Analytic Consultant  Market Job Description About Wells Fargo Philippines Wells Fargo Philippines enables global talent capabilities for Wells Fargo Bank NA., by supporting business lines and staff functions across Operations, Risk and Compliance, Project Management, Finance & Accounting and Data Analytics. We operate in Taguig City, Metro Manila.  Department Overview The Enterprise Compromised Date team is responsible for leading the assessment, investigation, and mitigation of compromised data incidents across the Wells Fargo enterprise, including ensuring data breach notifications to government regulators and individuals are handled appropriately.  About the Role  Also known internally as(Analytic Consultant 3) Responsible for consulting with partners to identify and define business requirements and translate business needs into complex analysis designs and recommendations. Identifies and recommends internal and external data sources, compiles/mines data from multiple, cross business sources; recommends and participates in the development of complex analysis designs using statistical and/or financial analysis, predictive modeling, process documentation, comparative analysis, customer/demographic analysis, etc.; interprets results and recommends solutions to increase revenue, reduce expense, maximize operational efficiency/quality, etc. Ensures adherence to data management/data governance regulations and policies. Data involved may be very large, structured or unstructured, and from multiple sources. To a certain degree, may assist indirectly in the technical build-out and/or support of databases, query tools, reporting tools, BI tools, dashboards, etc. that enable analysis, modeling, and/or data visualization. May manage project teams and provide guidance to less experienced team members. Demonstrated ability to build and maintain strong credible relationships with key stakeholder groups including executive management, regulatory examiners and internal auditors Ability to lead through adversity and adjust to changing priorities Extensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysis Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills Job Family Corporate Services  Region APAC  Country Philippines  City Manila  Location Metro Manila  We Value Diversity At Wells Fargo, we believe in diversity and inclusion in the workplace; accordingly, we welcome applications for employment from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, gender, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other status protected by applicable law. We comply with all applicable laws in every jurisdiction in which we operate.  About Wells Fargo Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC) is a leading global financial services company headquartered in San Francisco (United States). Wells Fargo has offices in over 30 countries and territories. Our business outside of the U.S. mostly focuses on providing banking services for large corporate, government and financial institution clients. We have worldwide expertise and services to help our customers improve earnings, manage risk, and develop opportunities in the global marketplace. Our global reach offers many opportunities for you to develop a career with Wells Fargo. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you will feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience. We are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

Job Title: Senior Data Engineer, Analytics Enablement & Processing
Job Description: Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.  Job Description  The Opportunity  The customer is the focus of everything we do, and millions of end users rely on our products daily. We believe in the value of empowering Date Engineers with the resources to solve critical problems for the future of our business, which is why we need you.  Manulife IT Delivery Center is seeking a self-motivated Data Engineer, who is obsessed with delivering value, is forward-thinking, and excited to develop and implement analytics-enabled solutions to improve business process, to generate insights, support business goals and strategy development  What motivates you?  ?£ You obsess about customers, listen, engage and act for their benefit  ?£ You think big, with curiosity to discover ways to use your agile mindset and enable business outcomes  ?£ You thrive in teams, and enjoy getting things done together  ?£ You take ownership and build solutions, focusing on what matters  ?£ You do what is right, work with integrity and speak up  ?£ You share your humanity, helping us build a diverse and inclusive work environment for everyone  We are looking for someone with:  ?£ Proficiency in the following languages: Hive, SQL, Python, R and Spark  ?£ Experience with at least two of the following analytics tools: Zeppelin, Jupyter Hub, R Studio, R Shiny, Neo4J, DataRobot or other analytics tools  ?£ Experience with HDP, CDH or other Hadoop platform  ?£ Knowledge of quantitative analysis and the ability to work with large datasets and databases  ?£ Knowledge of descriptive statistics, and use of appropriate charts and visuals for effective reporting  ?£ Knowledge of machine learning / predictive analytics such as time-series forecasting, regression (linear, GLM, etc.), decision trees, random forests, basket analysis, etc.  ?£ Knowledge of evaluating success of predictive models, both for classification (e.g. Percent Correct Classification, confusion matrix, lift, gain, Receiver Operating Characteristic and Area Under the Curve) and continuous (R-squared, average error, mean squared error, median error, average absolute error, median absolute error) models  ?£ Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel features such as pivot tables, pivot charts, filters, and functions  ?£ Ability to interpret and translate terminology between technical, business, and analytics users  ?£ Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  ?£ Excellent analytical, problem solving and solutioning skills  ?£ A capacity for constant learning from both success and failure  ?£ Open to change and continuous improvement  Nice to Haves:  ?£ Proficiency in SAS, Stata, Matlab or SPSS  On the job you will:  ?£ Develop Analytics best practices within Asia, including:  o Right tool for the right outcome  o Optimize analytics queries, machine learning and AI for analytics partners  o Simple and easy to follow standards  ?£ Bridge communications between Asia Data Office and various analytics teams across the region  ?£ Enhance analytics & AI deployment solution and frameworks  ?£ Enhance analytics data lab technologies and processes for better performance, efficiency and effectiveness in support of analytics & AI development activities  ?£ Proactively troubleshoot issues and work with relevant teams on resolution  ?£ Educate & train various teams on how to leverage best practices of existing and emerging technology capabilities in the data, analytics & AI space  ?£ Support Asia Data Office in development of internal analytical requirements  ?£ Support Analytics team as they optimize multivariate analysis, predictive modelling, cluster, market basket analysis using sophisticated statistical techniques  ?£ Present/visualize the data with the relevant use of graphs and charts in business intelligence clients, e.g. Power BI  ?£ Apply advanced analytics techniques to reveal actionable data insights and drive operations efficiency and business values  Our commitment to you  ?£ Our mission; to be a part of making Decisions Easier and Lives Better  ?£ A leadership team dedicated to your growth and success  ?£ A bold ambition and set of goals to be a leader in driving transformation in our industry  ?£ Our best. Every day.  Learn more about opportunities with us at jobs.manulife.com  If you are ready to unleash your potential, its time to start your career with Manulife/John Hancock.   About Manulife  Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2019, we had more than 35,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving almost 30 million customers. As of March 31, 2020, we had $1.2 trillion (US$0.8 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $30.4 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155 years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.  Manulife is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention and advancement and we administer all of our practices and programs based on qualification and performance and without discrimination on any protected ground. It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will consult with applicants contacted to participate at any stage of the recruitment process who request any accommodation. Information received regarding the accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Job Description: At Globe, our goal is to create a wonderful world for our people, business, and nation. By uniting people of passion who believe they can make a difference, we are confident that we can achieve this goal.  Job Description Establish and maintain an Effective Monitoring Tool/Database.Drills down performance metrics to a manageable level, identify painpoints and recommend areas of improvement with proponents.Consolidated and Reliable Report,Report Analysis & Improvement Plan,Drives high participation of all HR/Enterprise Survey thru department SPOCs  DUTIES & AND RESPONSIBILITIES  1. Responsible for delivering a broad scope of performance, process or SLA analysis services to NPE who will closely work with the rest of BRMS PRA data analysts, NSUP and BSC Champs within NPE  2, Develops methods to provide quantitative and qualitative analysis based on the requirement of a specific department  3. Conducts data analysis and visualization through charts, tables and graphs presented in power point deck  4. Creates feedback and reporting methodologies  5. Leads collection, integration and manipulation of large data sets  6. Designs and delivers robust analysis that may not be limited to performance, process and SLA improvements using RCA methods  7. Establishes performance monitoring protocols in collaboration with NSUP and OSS using the tool under Project Zoom which covers the following: Data Volume Utilization and Congestion Population Coverage Other automation for NPE BSC 8. Monitors monthly NPE BSC including KPIs of the departments and regularly liaise with the BSC Champs to feedback validation and insights if department is not meeting the targets  9. May design databases to store BRMS PRA analysis of different performance, process or SLA analysis  10. Communicates to BSC Champs all updates on NPE BSC including target setting requirements and timeline of submission  11. Leads BRMS PRA quarterly kumustahan and Q1/Q3 NPE Townhall  12. Works closely with other department leads to deliver an analysis strategy which meets the needs of all key stakeholders and disciplines in understanding and maximizing performance  13. Manages and delivers multi-disciplinary projects in collaboration with other departments  14. Executes Project Delivery based on internal and external collaboration  15. Evaluates individual capability by assessing current skills and competencies  Make Your Passion Part of Your Profession. Attracting the best and brightest Talents is pivotal to our success. If you are ready to share our purpose of Creating a Globe of Good, explore opportunities with us.

Job Title: GDS MST- Batch Reporting & Data Analyst (Senior Associate)
Job Description: Program Mercury is a large, multi-year, enterprise-wide process transformation that will replace more than 1400 EY business systems and related processes with an integrated, SAP centric platform that will standardize and harmonize activities throughout the organization and significantly improve how EY manages its business. Program Mercury is a key enabler of EY??s Vision 2020, directly supporting the efforts of a number of transformation initiatives across the Firm by streamlining the application portfolio, reducing operating costs and providing a platform to deliver services more efficiently. Program Mercury is currently in preparation of delivery of several deployments globally.  The opportunity  As an organization jointly owned by the business and IT, the Mercury Support Technology is a centralized and global organization which will provide operational support for the delivered Mercury solution and manage and support the Mercury user community. The MST will play an integral role in governance of the Mercury solution and the global template from both a business and IT perspective and will evolve to work closely with the business in enabling the benefit and value to be realized from the investment in Program Mercury and to set the future direction and technology road map to support Vision 2020.  Your key responsibilities  The MST Batch Reporting & Data Analyst will be the secondary point of contact in their time zone and support from Batch Operations for SAP across all weekends, month end and year end closes. Your role will be the preparation, communication, support and coordination to ensure we are tracking to task and understanding and communicating any business impacts if there are any issues or delays across weekend processing. The primarily role is to be available throughout the weekend as the secondary point of contact for the MST Batch Operations Team. It is expected of you to respond quickly and knowledgeably to batch processing related support, reporting and schedule requests in production (secondary in lower environments e.g. QA). You will be working with the MST Batch Reporting & Data Analyst Lead and teams across EYTech and Workload Automation to monitor system alerts, interfaces and batch jobs and helping to resolve incidents in production and lower environments where appropriate. Part of the role will include working with our automation team and being experienced at using the Control-M tool to analyse and schedule jobs. We will also look for your expertise in providing trend analysis on job performance and runtimes, data analysis and produce end to end daily batch production report summary for each pass across the weekend.  Skills and attributes for success  Adopting a logical and organized approach to problem resolution.  Ability to clearly articulate both problems and proposed solutions  Proactive approach to identifying issues and presenting solutions and options.  Analysing batch within SAP production and non-production environments and analysing control-M data, batch requirements and design  Ensuring the batch runbook is maintained and managed correctly. Assist in the completion of a robust runbook that optimizes support needs across various teams.  Working and teaming effectively with IT Services groups and other management personnel including on a global, virtual basis  To qualify for the role you must have  Bachelor??s Degree in Computer Science or relative proven experience with Batch reporting  Minimum of 3 years of solid experience in SAP batch reporting.  Excellent interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills - must be able to communicate fluently in English both verbally and in writing.  Experience working with SAP, Control-M, Change Management ChaRM, Solution Manager and ServiceNow or other workload automation tools.  Experience in reporting, management and review of batch processing and various technical activities for SAP.  Experience in managing of processing of data reporting that is happening for the system  Ability to facilitate design and requirement gathering discussions for batch scheduling.  Very good understanding of the customer strategy, services and business processes where it applies to batch processing.  looking for someone with batch management  Experience in Splunk tool for dash board analysis.  Provide quality metrics and reporting to promote compliance.  Experience in defining Process Models, Process Flows, Escalation Paths, Review Analytics and RACI development.  Complete Impact Assessments and have the ability to identify and manage Risks/Issues.  Experience with working with incident and problem team to resolve issues.  Experience with dealing with Operations and Service Support teams.  Experience across packaged and bespoke systems and infrastructure, ideally on an international basis.  Experience of Service management techniques gained through IT program/project delivery and in an IT support environment.  Ideally, you??ll also have  Ability to navigate through various OS systems and execute scripts (Windows , Unix and Linux, Oracle/ SQLPlus)  IT background with experience across the SAP development life cycle with experience in different project phases.  Understanding of business processes and finance workflow is preferable.  Track record of dealing with Executive Leadership  Experience in PowerBI  Experience in ServiceNow or worked with any ticketing tool  Knowledge with Windows , Unix and Linux, Oracle/ SQLPlus  Experience working within 3rd party vendors or being the vendor.  SAP certification  Project management certification  What we look for  We are looking for a self-starter, independent-thinker, curious and creative person with ambition and passion. We are looking for a high performer who can Builds successful partnership and persuades and influences internal and external stakeholders across diverse disciplines to promote engagement with the program and get stakeholder buy-in.  What working at EY offers  Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around  Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career  The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that??s right for you  About EY  As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we??re using the finance products, expertise and systems we??ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we??ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.  If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.  Make your mark.  Apply now.

Location Makati  TERMS  Contractual  Day Shift  System / Data Analyst  Seeking an IT professional with 6 years plus working as an System / Data Analyst, preferably with a banking or financial client.  Our banking client requires to migrate 1,200 servers, 300 applications and 200 databases from an existing Data Centre to a new Data Centre.  The PTS scope of work will be to review and verify the accuracy of a large manual database of all assets / locations, applications, databases, operating systems, storage and network and then to Identify a dependency matrix of service groupings with banks business units and identify priority of service groupings against criticality. The output of this matrix will enable the client to make sure that when a specific application is migrated that all of the associated elements of databases, storage, network, circuits etc. are understood so that during the move weekend that nothing is left behind which would invalidate a successful migration. Additionally a number of applications will need to be assessed against suitability for re-platforming on an existing virtual private cloud so to reduce the number of legacy servers during the migration.  The applications are across all platforms including Linux, Wintel, Solaris, Unix, AS400 etc. but note that the candidate does not need to be an expert in all platforms but have confidence and an understand when discussing with the client applications teams and the business.  The candidate will assist and support 2 x PTS Server / Application Migration Subject Matter Experts in collating data and information so to derive decisions on which applications are migrated to the public cloud, private cloud or migrate as a ??bare metal server??. The collation of data and information will also enable the interdependencies to be recognised so enabling the creation a migration run books that minimise risk.  Reporting Lines  The resource will report to the local PTS Architect PM and will work extensively with the Regional PTS DC Centre of Excellence Team (located in Australia) as the project owners and the local client.  Location  The location of work will be in Makati and the hours of work will be 8 hours a day 5 days a week with occasional weekend work. The candidate will be provided with a laptop but will provide their own mobile phone. Travel to and from work is included within the salary package.  Duration & Start Date  To start in August 2020 and run for 6 months with probable extension for a further 12 months if the candidate proves value to the client.  Interested candidates may send their resumes to info@joeriley.com.ph. or Call us at +63 917 8629986 | (02) 571-8052

Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries. In January 2018, we raised one of the largest Series C rounds ever in Southeast Asia and are well-positioned for our next phase of rapid growth.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  The Business Intelligence team arms Ninja Van across South East Asia with the means to make data-informed decisions at every turn. This includes BI tooling and infrastructure as well as thoughtful analysis. As Data Analytics Manager for PH, you??ll work closely with each part of the business, spanning across Operations (Delivery, Sort, First Mile, Last Mile, Middle Mile) and Demand (Sales, Marketing, CS). Take dashboard requirements and transfer into rapidly developed prototypes and working solutions. Remain detail-oriented while working across a wide variety of projects. Collaborate with different units in terms of data and table structures to optimize for KPI reporting. Manage relationships, deliverables and expectations with your business partners. Develop and implement Ninja Van??s strategy, ensuring the company delivers delight one parcel at a time. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or equivalent work experience. Experience using, writing and optimizing SQL queries in a business environment. Experience in business intelligence software (Tableau, Looker, Qlikview, MicroStrategy) and ETL software. Knowledge of data warehouse technical architecture, infrastructure components, ETL and reporting/analytic tools and environments. Expert in data extraction using SQL. Strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking paired with Intellectual curiosity and aptitude in picking up new technical skills. Ability to execute fast-paced and dynamic projects in a highly organized manner on a tight schedule. Work collaboratively across different functions and effectively influence senior business partners. Degree in Computer Science, IT, Math, Physics, Statistics, Engineering or quantitative field. Proficient with SQL(Postgres, MySQL, Redshift, Snowflake), Python3+ years of relevant work experience in analytics, data engineering, business intelligence or related field. Strong communication and presentation skills necessary to build effective working relationships and positively influence decision making. Strong business acumen. Job Description:
Job Description
Working at Thinking Machines
Thinking Machines is a data science startup. Our vision is for the Philippines to become a global hub for data science. To do that, we create data science cultures, one organization at a time. We??re a company made up of intellectually curious, civic-minded, forever-learning individuals. We believe that great data science products are built with care for people and that the best way to drive inclusive innovation is to start with a diverse team.
Our field of work is incredibly dynamic, so we want to work with people who are committed to growing with us. We want to hire people who can demonstrate an ability to learn, then provide them with personalized coaching, growth opportunities, and a great working environment to bring their skills to the next level and develop world-class talent.
Role Description
As a technology consultancy dealing with large amounts of data day-to-day, we recognize the importance of following data protection regulations set by local and international governing bodies. As the Data Protection Officer, it is your duty to analyze, monitor, and ensure all data processing activities of Thinking Machines are compliant to data privacy regulations such as the General Data Protection Regulation and the Data Privacy Act. This covers both our client projects and internal efforts, as well as our engagements with vendors and partners. You will be working closely with our Senior Leadership Team, as well as our Engineering team to fulfill this mandate.
From a process standpoint, this entails conducting control activities including, but not limited to, designing policies on data collection, access and processing, and conducting data access reviews, privacy impact assessments and Personally Identifying Information reviews, while ensuring these processes are both compliant and relevant to TM??s fast-paced, dynamic technology environment. From a legal standpoint, you will also be responsible for maintaining our legal compliance strategy and materials, such as securing local government permits with the SEC, and administering Data Sharing Agreements and Non-Disclosure Agreements.
You need to ensure our accreditation or certification, and renewal thereof, from relevant data privacy governing bodies to maintain proper regulatory standards. This includes becoming the officially appointed Data Protection Officer of Thinking Machines for the Philippines?? National Privacy Commission, and its equivalents.
In the event of security incidents, you will facilitate proper data breach and security incident management, and submit compliance documentation to the relevant governing bodies within the prescribed time frame.
Lastly, data security does not start and end with you; the whole organization has a crucial role in upholding our compliance standards. As such, you will be tasked to cultivate awareness within the company, advising employees on the data protection rules and regulations enforced by the relevant governing bodies, and write clear reports translating regulations into practical tactics.
As we continually expand the reach of Thinking Machines, this position is perfect for individuals interested in growing their legal expertise in international technology and data laws. We recognize that this is a new and growing field of practice. Would like to hire a driven, tenacious, dedicated learner who the company will invest in by providing training (both legal and technical) and opportunities to grow.
Requirements
We are looking for someone who has the following traits:
Knowledge of relevant privacy or data protection policies and practices
Experience in data management, data governance design and implementation
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal) to communicate concerns, issues, and solutions with both internal and external stakeholders
Project management skills to drive data governance related initiatives
Willingness and ability to learn the company??s technology stack, particularly cloud technologies
3-7 years of relevant previous experience 
Additionally, we are requiring candidates to have an internet connection speed of at least 12mbps and a viable work from home setup, as we are now operating as a fully remote company.
High preference for candidates that match one or more of the following:
Was previously a Data Privacy Officer for Philippine corporation  
Has experience working with technology startups
Has familiarity with Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, or Microsoft Azure
Is comfortable with technology, and has written code and workflow automation tools
Has a Juris Doctor degree or higher
Benefits and Perks
We offer the following compensation and benefits:
Competitive salary ?? the compensation amount is positively correlated with the difficulty of the job, relevant experience, fit, and skill factors.
Fully remote ?? due to the global pandemic, we have shifted to a fully remote company for the foreseeable future while we monitor the situation.
Individual professional development budget?? an annual budget for conferences, training courses, books, and software is available to sharpen your skills and build new ones to help you grow in your role.
Full health benefits ?? generous health insurance package

Job Summary
The Data Scientist will support the management, sales, leasing, marketing, operations, and the support teams with insights gained from analyzing company data. S/he must be adept in using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action.

Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions

- Visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using Tableau, Periscope, Business Objects, D3, ggplot, etc.

Job Description
At Remitly, we help immigrant communities around the world send over $6 billion a year to their loved ones. Sending money is faster, easier, and costs less with our all-digital money transfer platform. Our vision is to transform the lives of immigrants and their families by providing the most trusted financial service products on the planet. At Remitly, your work has a direct and positive impact on people around the globe. Your work matters, every day.
The Role
The Customer Success team at Remitly is responsible for earning lifetime loyalty and trust from customers by promptly answering their questions and resolving issues with their transactions. As a data analytics engineer on this team, you will work with operations leaders, data analysts, and data engineers to build, curate, and optimize the data pipeline we use to monitor our performance and identify future areas of improvement.  You will be accountable for maintaining the integrity of our data warehouse, writing ETL jobs and coding API integrations, building technical solutions for reporting and real-time insights, and supporting our analytics team by crafting datasets that are designed for efficient and accurate analysis. The quantitative insights you bring will have an out-sized impact on the business. You will report directly to our Manager of Data Analytics.
What You??ll Do
Become a subject matter expert on our data tools and pipeline, working with the wider engineer & analytics teams to build trust and deliver consistency across the business.
Serve as the owner of operational data, ensuring its accuracy and timeliness.
Own data integration, ETL processes, and data management capabilities of the team.
Monitor system performance and identify necessities in our platform.
Design and refactor database tables to optimize for efficiency, discoverability, and ease of use.
Create data requirements to ensure successful product launches.
Own documentation of procedures and deliver basic training on key tools and upgrades.
Understand, ideate, and create core definitions of key metrics & dimensions used by the analyst team.
Retrieve and analyze large datasets using SQL and other technologies.
Support cross-functional teams with ad hoc queries, data requests, and general data analysis.
Who You Are
Strong knowledge of SQL
Experience in data integration and/or ETL frameworks
Experience in software development using object-oriented programming languages
Experience with creating and deploying solutions that are hosted in cloud platforms like AWS, Salesforce, Azure or Google Cloud Platform
Experience with Git/Github or similar version control systems
Strong alignment to our mission and values
Proven problem solving and analytical skills with a data-driven mindset
Ability to partner effectively with management and internal teams
Strong written and verbal communication skills 
Preference for candidates with experience in developing large scale dataware (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, SCALA)
Preference for candidates with experience with data visualization and related tools (e.g. Tableau)
Who we are
Remitly is a group of passionate people working to make international payments easier and more transparent on both the web and mobile devices. We are seeking team members to join us that want to make a difference and change an industry. We pride ourselves on aiming high and delivering results, data being at the heart of everything we do, and encouraging our team to own business decisions and outcomes. Sound like the place for you? Join us.
Remitly is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals seeking employment at Remitly are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.
Remitly is an E-Verify Employer

Job Description
An exciting opportunity has arisen for an Data Processing Assistant to join Pageant Media??s growing research team.
The company

Pageant Media is a leading independent provider of business intelligence, data and insights on the global asset management industry, from hedge funds and mutual funds to private equity, real estate and credit/debt. Pageant has more than 2,500 institutional clients, including 94 of the world??s top 100 asset managers, who use our products to help them allocate assets, raise funds and run their business more effectively.
The role

The Cebu-based research team is tasked with delivering best-in-class data on institutional and private wealth investors, fund managers and their associated funds along with performance metrics, and the service providers acting across the entire industry.
Pageant is looking to further improve the quality of its data in terms of accuracy, timeliness, comprehensiveness and depth. The role presents an exciting opportunity for a self-motivated individual with a keen interest to learn about the asset management industry.
The role will involve researching a range of investor firm types, from large public pension plans to secretive family offices with an aim of gathering critical information around investment preferences and key events.
Responsibilities
Take ownership of a global universe of investors
Conduct web-based research to gather relevant information to update investor profiles
Ensure all financial data are accurate and up to date
Maintain a high level of quality across all profile builds
Liaise with contacts primarily through outbound emails and phone calls (internationally)
Participate in ad-hoc projects as assigned by supervisor
Attributes
Knowledge of the asset management industry would be advantageous
Work experience in a research-led environment is a plus
Advanced research abilities, diligent, with a keen eye for detail
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
Able to build relationships
Focused and target oriented
Language skills are highly desirable
Work Schedule:
9am to 6pm
Willing to work in Cebu City
Will be required to work mid-shift and overtime occasionally
Monday to Friday (excluding Philippines Public Holidays)
Work from home during ECQ or if needed. Please ensure you have stable internet connection at home before applying for this position.

Job Description
At FactSet, we're working to be the best financial data provider on earth. To get there, we need highly motivated, talented individuals who are empowered to find answers through creative technology.
As a Software Engineering Lead in Content Engineering, you will be part of our Digital Transformation, a mission to automate our data acquisition, quality assurance, content creation and analytics in a scalable cloud environment. With the guidance of financial experts, you will leverage these large data sets to improve the quality and extend the scope of FactSet's existing and next generation products. Job Description
Our company is building a team to drive innovation around data monetization and analytics. We are seeking a Data Engineer (Developer), with broad technical skills to dive deep into the design and implementation of data pipelines and data management processes.
Here's the impact you'll make and what we'll accomplish together
You will be responsible for creating and maintaining the data (ETL) pipeline for the company's Insights Platform, and building the components required for optimal extraction, transformation, cost efficiency management and the loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using Cloud technologies. You will be working with stakeholders including Product, Cloud, Data Lake and Integration teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support the data engineering needs of the Compnay's Insights Product. You will be responsible for creating data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
What you can expect from the role
  *   Leverage existing and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture
  *   Build analytics capabilities that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights
  *   Work with cross functional technology stakeholders to build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and big data technologies.
  *   Re-design infrastructure for greater scalability.
  *   Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional/non-functional business requirements.
  *   Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements including establishing standards for development processes and technical requirements; automating manual processes; optimizing data delivery, etc.
  *   Develop and ensure compliance for data management processes, policies and standards.
  *   Implement and enforce controls to maintain data availability and quality.
  *   Recognize and adopt best practices in data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation.
  *   Tune application and query performance using profiling tools and SQL.
  *   Review data at aggregate levels on a regular basis using analytical reporting tools to support the identification of risks and data patterns or trends.
  *   Work closely with cross functional teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
  *   Keep up-to-date with the latest technology trends and methods by staying abreast of state-of-the-art literature in the fields of advanced analytics, statistical modeling, and data management.
Skills/Qualifications
  *   Demonstrated experience in ETL, and data warehousing
  *   Demonstrated ability to build and optimize 'big data' data pipelines, architectures and data sets and computing tools such as Spark, MySQL, GCP, Azure, AWS, etc.
  *   Demonstrated knowledge of methods and techniques involved in Advanced Analytics, data mining, statistics, and optimization
  *   Coding proficiency in at least one modern programming language (Python, Java, etc)
  *   Demonstrated proficiency working with both relational (SQL) and non-relational databases (NoSQL).
  *   Demonstrated understanding of data privacy, security and related tools such as anonymization and encryption.
  *   Excellent oral and written communication skills and ability to clearly and fluently translate technical findings to non-technical partners and to communicate to multiple audiences using data storytelling and through graphics.
  *   Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in an interdisciplinary environment and to develop recommendations using facilitation and consensus building.
  *   Strong analytical, critical thinking, and evaluation skills to discern and help solve the important problems, while identifying new ways to leverage our data
You are the perfect fit if you have:
  *   Advanced expertise in Cloud, with Google Cloud Platform and BigQuery a strong asset, Dataflow and Composer
  *   Strong desire to work in a cross functional team environment
  *   Ability to think and solve complex data engineering problems in a maintainable and scalable fashion
  *   Desire to find new and better ways of doing things, generating original and imaginative ideas, products, and/or solutions
  *   Desire to embrace documentation creation & maintenance
  *   Ability to work independently and collaboratively with both local & non-local teammates
  *   Strong problem solving and organizational skills
  *   Impeccable written & oral communication skills with strong attention to detail
What we give back to you:
  *   Opportunity to show your stuff and be recognized and rewarded for excelling
  *   A dynamic and collaborative environment
  *   Opportunities for personal development through training, networking and career development
  *   An organization that actively supports you giving back to the community you live in
  *   A place that embraces our core values: Spirited teamwork, Courage to innovate, Embrace change and Initiate opportunity, and a Passion for growth
  *   Flexible work styles with the ability to work in and out of the office
Required Professional Designation/Certification:
University degree, preferably in Engineering, or Computer Science
Data Skills - General: ['data pipelines', 'data management', 'ETL', 'automating manual processes', 'optimizing data', 'data integrity', 'analysis', 'validation', 'data patterns', 'advanced analytics', 'statistical modeling', 'data warehousing', 'big data', 'architectures', 'data sets', 'data mining', 'statistics', 'Coding', 'relational databases', 'data storytelling']

Job Description:
Job Description
EY GDS ?? Consulting ?? Data Privacy Consultant
The opportunity
The Data Privacy Consultant will be primarily responsible for the development of data protection privacy strategies and roadmaps and performing PIA, DPIA and Data mapping. The main duties of the person in this role is to deliver various Data Privacy regulations and Privacy concepts. This person will interface with IT Operations, Network Operations, Infrastructure teams, Legal, Risk Management, etc.
Skills and attributes for success
Good knowledge of TCP/IP, concepts of OSI layer and protocols, networking and security concepts.
Strong knowledge of cyber / information security concepts, risk and controls concepts.
Experience in responding to Data Privacy Request for Proposals (RFPs).
Candidate should remain abreast of the industry trends and updated on Data Privacy standards, regulations and related technologies.
Good Understanding of Risk Assessment Frameworks.
Candidate should be able to prioritize tasks and work accurately under pressure in order to meet deadlines.
Excellent documentation and communication skills.
Foster teamwork and lead by example.
Training and mentoring of project resources.
Participating in the organization-wide people initiatives.

To qualify for the role, you must have
Bachelor of Technology (BE/B.Tech), M.Tech or ME in Computer Science, MCA or equivalent.
Work Experience: 3 to 4 years
Thorough understanding of various Data privacy regulations and privacy concepts (for e.g. GDPR, CCPA etc.)
Strong knowledge of standards such as ISO 27001/2, ISO 22301, ISO 27018, PCI ?? DSS, NIST standards on Cyber Security, HIPAA, HITRUST, etc.
Experience in performing PIA, DPIA and Data mapping etc. At least 3 years of experience in Privacy domain.
Experience in developing data protection privacy strategies and roadmaps.
Experience in planning and implementation of data protection and privacy controls.
Experience in creating Data privacy related training content and imparting cross functional training on Data Privacy.
Ideally, you??ll also have
Certifications related to Data Privacy such as CIPP, CIPM and/or ISO 27001 Lead Auditor and Lead Implementer, CISSP, CISA, CISM, CEH, etc.
Functional and non-functional privacy requirements definition and documentation experience.
What we look for
A Team of people with commercial acumen, technical experience and enthusiasm to learn new things in this fast-moving environment with consulting skills.
An opportunity to be a part of market-leading, multi-disciplinary team of 1400 + professionals, in the only integrated global transaction business worldwide.
Opportunities to work with EY Consulting practices globally with leading businesses across a range of industries.
What working at EY offers
At EY, we??re dedicated to helping our clients, from start??ups to Fortune 500 companies ?? and the work we do with them is as varied as they are.
You get to work with inspiring and meaningful projects. Our focus is education and coaching alongside practical experience to ensure your personal development. We value our employees and you will be able to control your own development with an individual progression plan. You will quickly grow into a responsible role with challenging and stimulating assignments.
Moreover, you will be part of an interdisciplinary environment that emphasizes high quality and knowledge exchange. Plus, we offer:
Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around.
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career.
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that??s right for you.

About EY
As a global leader in Assurance, Tax, Strategy & transactions and Consulting services, we??re using the finance products, expertise and systems we??ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we??ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.
If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
Join us in building a better working world. 

Apply now.

Job Description:
Job Description
Nasdaq (Nasdaq: NDAQ) is a global technology company serving the capital markets and other industries. We are looking for a strategic Workforce Planning Specialist to join the Global Talent Acquisition (GTA) team in Bonifacio Global City, Taguig. We look to recruit individuals with the passion to thrive in a highly dynamic and global environment, while offering unlimited growth opportunities, competitive salary, bonuses, and comprehensive benefits package. We are looking for candidates who share those values along with a genuine desire and drive to deliver strategic goals of the GTA team.
With this position we offer
A challenging role where you will be given an opportunity to establish and deliver an effective Strategic Workforce Planning Framework and related GTA People Analytics. This role provides technical solution and expertise in collecting data for workforce planning, hiring forecast, capacity planning, reporting and analytics. You will work with the Head of GTA, regional TA leaders, HR Operations and HRIS to develop automated dashboards that measures business results and promotes data driven story telling for the business/stakeholders.
Your team
The GTA team has been reimagined and developed over the last 3 years as a best-in-class function. We take great pride in the impact we have had on the company??s strategy of innovative growth through our ability to attract & hire world-class innovative and diverse talent across SW Engineering, Technology, Data, and Analytics. We as a team are aligned to our global Nasdaq strategy where we are tasked to deliver decisions through a lens of analytics and business priorities.  In order to keep this high level of strategic and analytical focus, we are responsible for ensuring our programs across Employer Branding, Diversity & Inclusion (D&I), Employee/Candidate Experience, TA Analytics and Governance are always delivering measurable results.
Your role and responsibilities 
Design a workforce management process, practice and methodology to ensure that critical business needs are met and/or exceeded
Develop and implement hiring forecast processes, design capacity plans with multiple levels of granularity and consider multiple factors impacting resource availability/productivity
Develop, implement and publish yearly headcount planning cycle and quarterly hiring forecast delivered within the committed timelines
Facilitate change and escalation process with regional teams from changes to hiring targets
Use data to collaborate with People Team to drive organizational design
Develop in depth Excel and other reporting tools, leverage analytics to ensure data-driven decisions are being made
Regularly meet with regional TA managers, Finance and People Team to present hiring updates, point out month-over-month changes and articulate root cause and predictions
Prepare stakeholder packet for workforce planning (location strategy, experience & talent mix of organization)
Provide a central view to the spectrum of Talent Acquisition data across all platforms and tools
Own and manage various initiatives for developing and automating processes and reports within the Talent Acquisition function
Support and assist with TA projects and initiatives when needed
We expect you to have
A Bachelor??s degree in a related discipline
At least 5 years of experience with workforce planning and/or management including headcount planning and allocation management
Experience in designing, developing and automating workforce management solutions to support strategic initiatives in HR
Prior experience in using Workforce Planning tools and technology
Analytical and problem solving skills with experience interpreting forecasts
Experience with complex data/analytics models and data visualization tools (e.g. PowerBI, SharePoint, Tableau)
Advanced Excel skills
Excellent communication skills, comfortable presenting to senior management
The ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment following a global service delivery model and amenable to work during US EST hours (8pm-5am)
It would be great if you have
Certifications in operations, quality, process management (e.g. COPC, Lean Six Sigma, LOMA)
Experience with finance and recruiting processes
Experience in Business Analysis or Project Coordination
Experience in developing dashboards and analytics on big data
Fun playing as a team and showing integrity

Company Overview
JG Summit Holdings, Inc. is one of the leading companies in the Philippines with business interests in: Air Transportation, Banking, Food Manufacturing, Hotels, Petrochemicals, Power Generation, Real Estate and Property Development, and Telecommunications.

The business of JG Summit started in 1957 when Universal Corn Products, Inc. (now Universal Robina Corporation) was established to operate a cornstarch plant in Manila. Since then, JG Summit has pioneered breakthroughs, broadened its enterprise and stayed at the forefront in every phase of the country's rise to development.

JG Summit has six (6) core businesses: branded consumer, agro-industrial and commodity food products in Universal Robina Corporation; real estate and hotels in Robinsons Land Corporation and United Industrial Corporation (Singapore); telecommunications and internet in Digital Telecommunications Phils., Inc.; petrochemicals in JG Summit Petrochemicals Corporation; air transportation in Cebu Pacific Air; and financial services in Robinsons Savings Bank and JG Summit Capital Services Corporation.

JG Summit's place in Philippine business has for its cornerstone a business portfolio of market leaders, a solid financial position, a formidable management team, and a vision of leading the country to global competitiveness and making life better for every Filipino.
