Job Description
Data Analyst - Financial Institutions (FI) / Insurance / eCommerce

Professional Services

Description As a Fraud Data Analyst, you??ll use data from the largest real-time fraud detection platform on the planet to craft solutions for our enterprise customers. Your experience with data analysis, investigating suspicious behaviour and providing new insights to customers will lead to immediate real-world impact in the form of increased profits, lower authentication friction, and reduced credential abuse.

You??ll leverage a real-time platform analysing billions of logins, payments, account openings and other events per month for our Fortune 500 customers in Financial Services, Insurance, eCommerce, and On-Demand Services. These tools will allow you to attain a unique perspective of the Internet and every persona connected to it.

You??ll be continually collaborating with internal product and engineering teams, customer-facing account teams, and external business leaders and risk managers. The comprehensive policy you build will go head-to-head against some of the most motivated attackers in the world to protect billions in revenue.

Responsibilities:
??£ Review suspicious activity and complex fraud cases to help identify and resolve fraud risk trends and issues.
??£ Clearly and thoroughly document investigation findings and conclusions
??£ Understand how to write rules in ThreatMetrix decision engine and manage customer risk policy, leveraging hundreds of signals in the ThreatMetrix Digital Identity Network and data fed directly into the network by our customers.
??£ Offline analyses of customer data to tune rules, exposes patterns, research anomalies, reduce false positives, and build executive and project level reports.
??£ Identify meaningful insights from fraud data, such as chargebacks, account takeovers and social engineering events. Interpret and communicate findings from analysis to internal and external stakeholders.
??£ Collaboration with ThreatMetrix teams including Products, Engineering, and your colleagues to continually redefine best practices by enhancing tools, data sources, system functionalities, and fraud detection methods.
??£ Educate internal team members and external parties on processes and procedures.
??£ Demonstrate a professional and customer-centric persona when interacting directly with partners and customers via phone, e-mail, and chat.
??£ Risk and Technology consulting; sharing best practices with fraud managers, risk analysts, application developers, and project managers for combating persistent and emerging security threats.

Requirements Ideal Candidates:

??£ Minimum 3 years?? experience in fraud analytics in Financial Institutions (FI)/ECommerce or fraud vendor space.
??£ Ability to make decisions with limited and conflicting information.
??£ Solid knowledge of Card Not Present (CNP) environment, ACH, ACH Returns, Credit Card Chargebacks, Account Takeover Patterns, Login, Compromise.
??£ Strong SQL skills.
??£ Python/R skills 
??£ Fluency with data analysis and visualization tools (Arcadia or Tableau is a plus).
??£ Experience working with Rules Engines.
??£ A keen eye for detail, accuracy and strong critical thinking skills with advanced judgment capability.
??£ Extensive multi-tasking and prioritization skills needs to excel in fast paced environment with frequently changing priorities.

Job Description
The role of the Data Engineer is responsible for building and maintaining optimized and highly available data pipelines that facilitate deeper analysis and reporting. The Data Engineer builds data processing frameworks that handle the business??s growing database. The Data Engineer strives to continuously develop new and improved data engineering capabilities.

Data Strategy & Development
The Data Engineer owns and extends the business??s data pipeline through the collection, storage, processing, and transformation of large data-sets.
It is his duty to monitor the existing metrics, analyze data, and lead partnership with other Data and Analytics teams in an effort to identify and implement system and process improvements.
The   Data Engineer will additionally develop queries for ad hoc business projects, as well as ongoing reporting. In this capacity, the   Data Engineer builds a metadata system where all available data is maintained and cataloged. The   Data Engineer also plays a major role in the development of reliable data pipelines that translate raw data into powerful features and signals.
He designs, architects, implements, and supports key datasets that avail structured and timely access to actionable business insights. The   Data Engineer is additionally tasked with developing ETL processes that convert data into formats through a team of data analysts and dashboard charts.
Collaboration & Support
The   Data Engineer plays a collaborative role where he/she works closely with the business??s Data and Analytics teams, gathering technical requirements for exceptional data governance across the department and the business at large.
In this collaboration, the   Data Engineer works the data analysts, data warehousing engineers, and data scientists in finding and applying best practices within the Data and Analytics department as well as defining the business??s data requirements, which will ensure that the collected data is of a high quality and optimal for use across the department and the business at large.
The   Data Engineer will also work with data science team and departments beyond the Data and Analytics department in analyzing and understanding data sources, participating in design, and providing insights and guidance on database technology and data modeling best practices.
??
Perform Testing
Perform unit tests and assist in performing UAT with the business partners and associates. Address all defects found during the testing period.
Project documentation and correspondence
Produce technical design as required. Write user manuals when necessary. Manage meetings with stakeholders. Provide timely updates on different phases of the project. Communicate to the business timely updates on the project/request.
Data Administration
Resolve issues and defects reports raised by the end-users within the stipulated timeline. Enhance ETL/ELT based on new requirements. Provide development timeline assessment.
The role is expected to support the Global Business Services (includes centers outside of their geographic location)
The role is expected to produce reliable results within the usual 4-week development period (except when there??s unusual factors involved)
To qualify for this role, you must have:
4 years graduate in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, or any other technology related field.
Minimum 2 - 3 years functional experience with 3 year of specific experience in Data Engineering.
?? Mid level/Expert Experience with ETL/ELT tools & object function scripting languages: Python, SSIS, AWS Glue.
Ability to implement complex & advance data warehouse & data models.
?? Experience in building and maintaining reliable and scalable ETL on big data platforms
?? Experience working with varied forms of data infrastructure inclusive of relational databases such as T-SQL, Hadoop, Spark and column-oriented databases such as Redshift, MS SQL.
Experience with AWS cloud services: AWS Glue, RDS, EC2, Redshift, S3 Data Lake ?? Multi-Tiers, Lambda, Amazon Athena.
Data Skills - Specific: ['Python', 'SSIS', 'AWS Glue', 'T-SQL', 'Hadoop', 'Spark', 'column-oriented databases', 'Redshift', 'MS SQL', 'AWS cloud services', 'S3 Data Lake', 'Lambda', 'Amazon Athena']

Job Title: Senior Big Data ETL Integration Engineer
Job Description:
Job Description
Here at Macquarie, we are putting our customers first and changing how the world interacts with banks. We understand that banking in the future will be predominantly digital and so we??re building our platforms from the ground up to match. We use technology as a catalyst to bring people together and help them realise their life ambitions through our products and solutions, which are designed by humans for humans.
The Role
We are searching for a Big Data Integration Engineer to join our team and play a lead role in our data transformation projects. In this role, you will help us define and drive Big Data and Talend ETL standards and best practices across our teams. You will design and implement ETL frameworks and various metadata-driven reusable components. You will have end-to-end accountability for developing, deploying, and supporting our data assets. Additionally, you will help grow your teams?? technical expertise and stay abreast of new technologies and practices to enhance team capabilities and skills further.
Qualifications
Successfully delivered a project, with experience working in Agile and DevOps environment
Proficient oral and written communications skills
Dedicated, adaptable and able to quickly understand new concepts and apply them correctly
Independent worker with effective interpersonal skills including mentoring, coaching, and team building
Highly proficient in at least two of the following:
             *Talend ETL toolset (ideally both Talend Data Integration and Talend Big Data editions)
             *Data warehousing with emphasis on the Information Management domain
             *Big Data technologies such as Hive, Spark, Presto, AirFlow, general purpose storage (HDFS, S3, BLOB) and other Hadoop / Apache tools
Experience in Data modelling using Data Vault 2.0 methodology will be highly appreciated
Knowledge of different Spark-based PaaS solutions like EMR or DataBricks as well as programming languages like Scala or Python will be additional advantage
Knowledge of CI/CD and code coverage analytical tools
Familiarity with at least one cloud platform, preferably AWS or GCP
Familiarity with configuration management tools and containerization technologies
Familiarity with security/vulnerability tools
Familiarity with monitoring tools

What??s in it for you
Our work environment is modern and inclusive with a strong focus on employee experience 
You??ll be part of a team that deeply values diversity and creates space for you to be your best
You'll have flexible working options, including working from home 
You??ll have opportunities to experiment and test your own ideas to see where they can lead
We support ongoing professional development and technical certifications to help you develop your knowledge and skills
About Banking and Financial Services  
Banking and Financial Services is Macquarie??s retail banking and financial services business, providing a diverse range of personal banking, wealth management, business banking and vehicle finance products and services to retail clients, advisers, brokers and business clients.  
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion 
Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.
We recognise that flexibility comes in a variety of forms. Talk to us about what flexibility you need.
Data Skills - Specific: ['Talend ETL', 'Agile', 'Talend', 'ETL', 'Talend Data Integration', 'Talend Big Data editions', 'Hive', 'Spark', 'Presto', 'AirFlow', 'HDFS', 'S3', 'BLOB', 'Hadoop', 'Apache', 'DataBricks', 'Scala', 'Python', 'CI/CD', 'AWS', 'GCP']

Job Description
Market Intelligence (MI) provides critical data and insight to global asset managers, insurance companies and distributors to help them make informed, strategic decisions to manage and grow their business. Through its combination of proprietary and integrated datasets, in-depth global research and trusted executive engagement, ISS MI delivers solutions for market sizing, competitor benchmarking, product strategy and opportunity identification across a wide range of financial products including funds, annuities, insurance, mortgages, and other instruments.  The ISS MI solutions include the industry-leading data platforms Simfund, BrightScope, Local Market Share, and Financial Clarity, as well a full collection of global research and analytics services including Investor Economics, Market Metrics, and Plan for Life.
Job Overview:
The Enterprise Analyst team works with our product clients to obtain, clean, and aggregate various data platforms into our data system. The Enterprise Analyst will help manage all inbound and outbound data feeds, as well as work with the team to ensure the quality and accuracy of the data deliverables. The team assesses and analyzes this data to provide actionable business intelligence for our clients. Through the use of SQL, Excel, and other technology tools, the analyst will complete client requests in a timely manner and provide meaningful analysis about patterns and trends in the industry. The Enterprise Data Analyst also works closely with the Development, Product, and Client Engagement team to ensure data needs are met and delivered in a timely manner.
Responsibilities:
Maintain Sales Reporting and our product Nexus
Communicate and support clients as it relates to data processing needs
Conduct data assessments and deliver analysis to clients using SQL and Excel
Create and maintain QA Checks on all incoming files and outgoing client feeds
Use Python or other tools to help QA data outputs and create data visuals for other teams
Partner with Implementation Team to gather information and transition new clients as they join the data consortium
Utilize JIRA to manage projects and communicate with Development and Client Engagement
Use quantitative methods to identify market trends to help companies make better business decisions
Have or develop a strong understanding of the Retirement/Investment Industry from a data perspective
Qualifications:
Willing to work the graveyard shift permanently(8:30 AM ?? 5:30 PM PDT / 11:30 PM ?? 8:30 AM Manila time)

Job Description
Founded in 2011, Willow is a global technology start up moving rapidly into it's next stage of growth. We are harnessing the true potential of data to transform disconnected built assets into living, learning, and evolving digital twins.
Ranked in Linked In's 2018 Australian "Top 25 Startups", you will be joining a team of performance driven individuals, backed by the most advanced technology the built world has ever seen. We are chartering a new course, Digital First, the Willow Way. Our 'Willow World' is fast paced, nurturing and collaborative.
Willow Inc.
Willow is a global technology company with offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Manila, New York, Seattle, Charlotte, London and Tel Aviv.
Willow delivers a software platform, WillowTwin?? and professional services, WillowDigital?? to accelerate digital adoption. These distinct, but related parts of our business work together to guide, build and manage the journey to smart buildings and infrastructure networks, at a project and portfolio level.
WillowTwin?? is a ground-breaking software platform that re-imagines the digital twin for the built world. Our platform integrates, analyses and manages data at scale, delivering insights to improve performance and experience of buildings and infrastructure networks.
WillowDigital?? delivers digital engineering and architecture services to customers. Our team understands the processes required to harness the technology of today, innovation of tomorrow and unlock the power of data within the portfolios of both buildings and infrastructure networks.
We are seeking an MEP Modeller who will be part of an integrated team performing modelling of building (MEP) services and will involve providing BIM production services using Revit MEP. MEP family development

Engineering focused qualification
3+ years?? experience in:

Design Consultants drawing experience (and/or) Contractors Construction drawing experience
active projects producing construction documents using Revit MEP

Understanding of LOD??s (level of development) and modelling requirements for the respective levels to be achieved and what should be included in each stage of project.

Job Description
Our client is a fast-paced start-up co-founded by successful entrepreneurs with the backing of key strategic investors in the video game industry. Client aims to work with popular online video games to improve player experience. Client is developing a scalable and secure data platform to process large amounts of game data and building systems to help detect various game and player events.
As the Data Engineering Lead, you will primarily grow and manage the data engineering team in region and work with other engineering teams to design and build data pipelines. You will collaborate closely with other Engineering Leads, Machine Learning Engineers, Architects, and Product teams to identify, build, test, and deploy data collection, management, and curation tools. You are also responsible for productionizing data manipulation and data management services. You will review requirements with Machine Learning Engineers, Product Managers and Analysts. You will work closely with Engineering Leads and Architects to ensure efficient use of resources and to help ensure proper integration with our broader cloud infrastructure.

We are seeking a talented data engineer lead to join our team. Your responsibilities as a data engineer lead will include:
- Recruiting and growing the data engineering team
- Managing and working directly with data engineers in region
- Overseeing overall tool development to add to our data platform
- Overseeing software engineering and the design of various data pipelines
- Working together with other engineering and product team leads and executives

What we are looking for:
- 5+ years of industry experience collecting data and building data pipelines
- Degree in Computer Science or related field
- Experience growing and managing a team of engineers
- Experience overseeing engineers and their execution towards team goals
- Experience with Python or relevant scripting language
- Experience with databases
- Experience building data pipelines from end to end:
o Understanding business use cases and requirements for different internal teams
o Prototyping initial collection and leveraging existing tools and/or creating new tools o Building and deploying scalable data pipelines for production
o Maintenance of such pipelines
- Experience working different types of datasets (e.g. unstructured, semi-structured, with missing information)
- Ability to think critically and creatively in a dynamic environment, while picking up new tools and domain
knowledge along the way
- A positive attitude, and a growth mindset
- Familiarity with different data stores (e.g. flat files, buckets, graph, columnar, NoSQL)
- Experience with Cloud infrastructure (e.g. AWS) and relevant microservices

Bonus:
- A passion for gaming =)
- Advanced Degree in Computer Science or related field
- Experience with open source data processing frameworks (e.g. Spark)
- Experience with relevant Python libraries such as Beautiful Soup, Requests, Scrapy, Selenium

Job Description:
Job Description
We are looking for a candidate to join our Strategic Analytics group. This position will work with our internal client teams to both analyze and visualize structured and unstructured data.  The successful candidate will possess a keen analytic mind as well as a flair for visual design.

This position will assist in the analyses of large-scale client databases, including customer profiling, segmentation studies, post-program measurement, and other ad-hoc projects.  Candidates should have solid experience evaluating large amounts of consumer data and culling out key insights to support data-driven marketing opportunities, along with a background in fundamental statistical concepts.
The candidate will also play a key role in creating visually stunning and effective data visualizations and dashboards.   They should be skilled at converting raw data into an interactive image or design that tells a compelling story and aids business decision-making.
Primary Responsibilities
Assist in the design, day-to-day management and delivery of client analyses and data visualizations
Collaborate & communicate effectively with client and internal teams to identify analytic objectives and approach
Document business and functional requirements for dashboards
Develop analytic plans (including sampling plans and programming specs)
Extract data from client systems and write programming code required to clean, transform, analyze and visualize the resulting datasets
QC programming output
Ensure that client deliverables are produced on time and error-free
Stay up to date with the data visualization marketplace and new product developments and features
Participate in product training and client demos as needed
Utilize speech and text mining tools to uncover actionable customer insights
Qualifications / Experience
2+ years of experience in marketing analysis, database marketing, or business intelligence roles, ideally across marketing, CX and VoC business functions
Demonstrated ability to develop and interpret analytic output
Proven ability to create data visualizations that are well designed and tell a compelling visual story
Strong attention to detail
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Comfortable working in a team-oriented, deadline driven environment
Self-starter, self-educating and self-motivated with an insatiable curiosity
Manage personal tasks & workload with ability to prioritize and multitask
Knowledge of basic statistical concepts; a working knowledge of multivariate statistics (i.e., regression, cluster analysis, CHAID, etc.) would be helpful.
Deep experience using data extraction and analysis tools, such as SQL, Python, or R and data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI is required.
Working knowledge of unstructured data analysis tools is a plus
Business, economics, or quantitative methods background preferable.  Graduate degree is a plus.

Apply today!

Job Description
SHORT DESCRIPTION: 
Develop, manage and implement the Center's Research Program, primarily responsible for the production and generation of knowledge through research and other related activities towards developing a climate lens to issues affecting Philippine progress 
Lead the identification and development of targeted climate and related information from research design to implementation to drive awareness, understanding, and appreciation of science-based knowledge towards resilience building and sustainable development
RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Knowledge production - Research 
??Develop and manage research projects, including managing and developing frameworks, methodologies and overall design, on climate change and its impacts, and on resilience building and sustainable development
Undertake and oversee the design and development of quantitative and qualitative research tools, literature reviews, data processing and analysis to produce information on climate change and its impacts,  resilience building and sustainable development
In collaboration with other units and external groups, conduct research on user needs and skills, develop key messages, effective knowledge delivery and engagement mechanisms, and impact of Center initiatives
Direct the production of insightful research reports and knowledge products with actionable advice to support the Center??s target publics in resilience building and sustainable development
Keep the Center up to date with developments in key research and latest knowledge on climate change, sustainable development and resilience 
Develop systems, manuals, guidelines, relevant to knowledge products
 2. Scientific collaboration
      a. Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team, and work closely with other functional entities within and outside the 
Knowledge Production Unit to ensure a coordinated and holistic approach to addressing climate-related risks and building resilience 
          i. Co-develop, with internal and external actors, a framework for co-production to inform and guide Center??s user-centered approach to the development of innovative products
          ii. Ensure interaction between and among the target users and the Center's scientists, researchers, fellows, partners and collaborators to improve the Center's research
     b. Provide technical support in: 
          i. Developing communications and messaging agenda, and other related plans, programs and projects of the Center 
          ii. Implementing the grants mechanism, including conceptualization, implementation and evaluation of grant projects and screening/selection of grantees
          iii. Developing project proposals for external funding applications
     c. Serve as resource person in meetings, discussions and similar fora; publications,   reports and technical or other documents 
3. Administrative 
Develop, oversee, and manage staff and budgets 
Prepare technical and financial reports based on the outputs of the research activities 
Assist in the preparation of the Annual Work and Financial Plan of the Center and in the conduct of periodic monitoring and evaluation of projects 
Provide inputs to the development of systems, policies, procedures and manuals 
Qualifications
 
Master??s degree in Climate Science, Environmental Science,  Social Science, Development, or related fields
With at least ten (10) years of research experience in a non-profit/research/academic environment and strong background in climate change related researches
Formal training in / technical knowledge of climate change, climate resilience, sustainable development, with social science research and science communication an advantage
Experience in project management, coordination and development
Team player but can work independently (under minimum supervision)
Strong analytical, verbal and written skills

Job Title: Amazon PPC Expert - Remote Work (URGENT HIRING)
Job Description:
Job Description
We are looking to add an Amazon PPC Expert to our team who is proven to be a Data Scientist!

What is your primary responsibility?
--- Assist the CMO with PPC and Marketing Activities.

This includes the following tasks:
--- Should be knowledgeable with Helium 10, Seller Tools, etc.
--- Optimize product listings via intensive keyword research
--- Optimize AMS, PPC, Sponsored product campaigns with various methods
--- Obtain a deep understanding of each product in the catalogue
--- Plan, develop, and implement comprehensive strategies to increase sales, visibility, brand recognition and drive sales across Amazon sponsored ads
--- Report to the CMO

What makes you perfect for this position?
--- Well versed in all of the components of the Campaign Manager
---------- Different types of Campaigns
---------- Ad groups
---------- Bids
---------- Keywords/Negative Keywords
--- Basic understanding of PPC mechanics
---------- Adjusting bids
---------- Adding keywords/negative keywords
---------- Creating/uploading bulk files
---------- Making decisions based on Search Term Report data
--- Proficiency in Microsoft Excel IS A MUST specifically VLOOKUP functionality
--- 2-3 of years experience working as a PPC Specialist in an Amazon environment

Work From Home Set-Up & Work Schedule. Since this role is 100% remote, we require:
--- A stable internet service is a must. The primary internet should be cabled wired on either DSL or FIBER connection with a download/ upload minimum speed of 10 Mbps.
--- Should have a backup internet solution - LTE Mobile Data or Pocket WIFI
--- Willing to work night shift - US EST Hours
--- A desktop Computer or Laptop preferably with Intel i3 or equivalent processor, Windows 7 and above or MAC OSX OS, 4GB RAM
--- A good headset with extended microphone and noise cancellation is preferred
--- Good external or integrated webcam

What role will you play in our company?
--- As our Amazon PPC Specialist, you will be critical in "behind the scenes" tasks. We need you to be a Critical Thinker, organized, and have exceptional attention to detail. You will be a big contributor as we reach our goal of having "self-run" seller central accounts that need little maintenance. Your participation in our company is to help us complete tasks that directly affect the success of our clients. Our vision is to ALWAYS BRING VALUE to our Clients.

Please write us a message explaining your skill level with Microsoft Excel and Amazon Seller Central. Please do not forget to send a link to your CV and include your email, mobile number, and Skype ID.

We look forward to hearing from you & working with you!

Job Title: Technical Service Scientists - Molecular Biology (Night Shift)

Job Description
As a Technical Service Scientist, you are responsible to :

Acquire and apply constantly changing knowledge of technology, products, and processes.

Preferably with MS or PhD in Molecular Biology or related field

Broad theoretical and practical knowledge of Molecular Biology and related techniques
Extensive research experience/background
Fluency in written and verbal English
Ability to take ownership of complex information and customer interactions, to provide excellent support with focus on customers, and to work in a changing environment.
Ability to adjust tone and language as needed to manage interactions and maintain positive relationships with customers and coworkers.
Ability to work in teams across multiple countries, cultures, and time zones
Must be willing to work on the night shift
Must be willing to work in McKinley West, Taguig City

Job Description
JOB PURPOSE/MISSION/SUMMARY:

CDM Team is responsible for the collection, correction of errors in the CDM Portal, completeness and timeliness of channel reported data (sales out, inventory and retail reports) by doing analysis, validation and cleansing. This is a significant aspect for Lexmark to make sound decisions related to sales, accuracy in commissions, sales & marketing analysis and forecasting and rebates payout.
The data analyst collects data on product, material, customer, vendor, sales numbers, market research, logistics, or other behaviors. The role requires technical expertise to ensure the quality and accuracy of that data, then process, design and present it in ways to help people, businesses and organizations make better decisions.
KEY ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES / KEY JOB FUNCTIONS:

?? Understand that data are strategic business assets
?? Identify opportunities to transform-connect datasets to deliver business value added solutions
?? Mine and analyze data across databases to support process optimization / improvement
?? Operationalize the application of data to deliver optimized process thru world-class data and analytics governance
?? Deliver insightful information leveraging on the 3 expertise axes: business acumen, transactional and reporting tools
?? Build and implement data models through machine learning while making sure that accuracy and integrity of data is kept
?? Collaborates with the business teams to break data and organizational silos, thereby, solving rea-world problems faced by the organization and finding opportunities for improvement across projects, teams and business units.
?? Collaborates with the IT teams to leverage solution that would enable the teams to provide decision makers an intuitive, interactive, self-service environment that enables them to monitor business results, predict outcomes and drive action plans for optimal business performance
?? Setup of new reporting partners.  This includes the creation of the profile and the mapping of the data provided to the Global Template. The setup will involve working directly with the partners and country key users. 
?? Daily monitoring to verify the Partners reporting match what was expected.

Job Description
We are looking for a Data Analyst to analyze large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve AEON and its affiliates. We will rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights.
In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We also want to see a passion for machine-learning and research.
Your goal will be to help our company analyze trends to make better decisions.
Job Responsibilities:
The Data Analyst is responsible for providing strategic, analytical, and technical support in all business intelligence activities for AEON.
The DA will work closely with the IT/Marketing Operations Team to provide technical support and input into the research and development of AEON's products.
The Data Analyst will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. He/She will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
Develop statistical modeling techniques for pattern recognition problems.
Develop codes in R, Python, or other tools for statistical analysis, optimization, and simulation.
Strategic planning and project management.
Extract, transform and analyze data using statistical techniques that will help the organization make business decisions based on data.
Develop/create and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and ??clean? data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Perform data analysis that provides a platform for decision making on a variety of business issues.
Apply his/her expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and guide applicable next steps.
Understand clients?? needs and priorities to create detailed models.
Conduct or run statistical analyses to extract actionable insights that influence, support, and assist in product decisions and launches.
Present proposals and results in a clear manner backed by data and coupled with actionable conclusions.
Qualifications:
Bachelor??s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent related field
1-3 years data analyst or related experience
Excellent presentation skills, as well as data visualization using Tableau and Jaspersoft
Experience with statistical and mathematical software such as R, Python.
Should be a well-rounded top performer who can work effectively and proactively in cross-functional teams.
Proven ability to develop system prototypes.
Creative self-starter with a combination of strong business acumen and technical ability.
Excellent SQL skills (familiarity with PostgreSQL, Oracle is preferred)
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Strong documentation skills.
Understanding of machine learning techniques and the ability to invent.
Applicants must be willing to work in Ortigas/Shaw area.
Applicant must be willing to have overseas business trip for onsite implementation

Job Description
About the role:
We are looking for a collaborative, detail oriented and motivated Data Analyst to work closely with all business groups and regions. This role is responsible for the collation of environmental data analytics/reporting to support internal business management processes to aid in the carbon zero strategy. Working with all business functions the role will focus on collating, extracting, analysing and presenting business significant data to enhance our understanding of greenhouse gas emissions and other environmental data to facilitate alignment with our 2048 science based target.
You will work closely with the VP of Operations ensuring that maximum business value is extracted from all our data sources.

About you:
You will demonstrate our six behavioural values; collaborative, decisive, empowering, innovative, responsible and responsive as you work toward your goal. You will thrive working with multiple teams, offering excellent communication lines and a clear sense of direction.
You will be highly numerate, detail focused, collaborative and independent worker. You will have a high level of knowledge/capability with regard to data manipulation, data problem resolution and use of data tools and systems. Your documentation and communication style should be clear and concise.
Under direction and in collaboration with other teams you should have the ability to analyse multiple data sets and articulate outcomes and findings.
Principal Accountabilities
To assist across the Press with all data analysis activities ensuring that maximum business value is extracted from all our data sources. In particular, this role will:
Work to improve the accuracy and efficiency of data across the Press
Gain a comprehensive understanding of all data, its characteristics, manifestations and idiosyncrasies ensuring we continue to collect and retain all that is relevant in a fast changing landscape.
Gain a comprehensive understanding of all the systems and tools wherein this data resides, evaluate and assess their utility in an ongoing way and recommend developments to enhance our capabilities.
To fulfil business needs, develop new reports/analysis or existing outputs to give new insights into our business, for science-based targets, aligning to our 2048 target
Ensure that the analysis produced is presented and packaged in user friendly formats accessible to the non-technical.
Develop appropriate communication to ensure wide dissemination of data analysis outputs to help drive a more evidenced based approach
System superuser for BO/Cognos/WoS/Core usage data / other tools
Feed back to the business with recommendations for improved data acquisition, data handling best practice or process improvements
Stay informed about data analysis developments by identifying training needs and attending training sessions
Working across multiple zones with all key branches and SSO
We offer
Competitive Salary
Up to 33 days Paid Annual Leaves
HMO Coverage and Life Insurance on day 1
Vesting/Retirement package
Learning Opportunities
Flexible work arrangement

?? Analytical mindset and critical thinking is a must

Job Title: Data Analyst - Australian Client - SAS Experience
Job Description:
Job Description
If you are a Data Analyst Professional who wants to explore a role with the Australian Actuarial Team, working at an amazing company and competitive team in Manila, now is the time to show off your Analytical Skills! 
Our client, a locally-owned unlisted public company, is engaged in the provision of workers compensation and insurance services in Australia. Growing their team of Data Analyst here in Manila, you are responsible to assist the team in AU for data reporting and documentation. You will report directly to Team Manager in AU and work with a team of Data Analyst here in Manila. 
Job Responsibilities:
You need to develop an understanding of the data structures and fields in the claims administration databases
Build and maintain robust and productive internal and external relationships appreciate the needs of the business and to facilitate the delivery of its strategy and objectives.
Enhance and maintain the existing reporting suite and assist the users to utilise and interpret the results.
Develop and assist with statistical and financial modelling as required
Assist in the development, calculation and monitoring of the various metrics of scheme performance,  operational monitoring and lead indicators of performance across the organisation.
Drive continuous improvement and innovation by providing recommendations to enhance and improve current processes including: methodologies, reporting, monitoring, performance indicators and documentation.
Ensure quality documentation is produced based on business requirements.
Assist relevant department on all actuarial and business analysis requirements and studies.
Prepare actuarial/statistical and financial reports essential to management.
Qualifications, Skills & Experience:
Bachelor??s degree in the field of Actuarial Science, Statistics or Math
Minimum 3 years experience in a similar work capacity
Strong analytical skills with a demonstrated ability to analyse business processes and workflows
Competent in the use of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint
Competence and experience with SAS software
Competent and experienced in SQL programming and R is also advantageous.
Excellent organisational ability including the use of effective time management
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Benefits:
Dayshift (Monday to Friday)
Career training inside the company
Friendly Environment and Culture
Health & Life Insurance
Paid Leave
Team outing, travel opportunities, company party and other exciting activities
Industry-related training and international exposure
Career advancement opportunities; vertical and horizontal development
Your Career is important??. Don??t miss out on this great opportunity, apply now and be part of our global team!

Job Description
Analytics Application Developer, Strategic Analytics Services, you will play a crucial role in developing applications to bridge the gap between predictive models and end users. You will work closely with IT on high-profile analytics projects that drive the company??s decision-making and strategy. As a key member of the Strategic Analytics team, you will advance our integration of predictive analytics within various business units and processes.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with data scientists, business partners, and IT to develop and implement software applications using Python, R, SQL, Databricks Notebooks, and/or Azure Data Factory.
Build strong partnerships with peers across the organization to support analytics-based business decisions and improved technical system workflows.
Continuously build on our team??s development and testing efficiencies and help develop best practices to improve Strategic Analytics models speed to market and consistent in future projects.

Discover and explore new technologies, tools, and packages with curiosity and creativity.
Manage requirements and design of predictive analytics applications throughout the development lifecycle.

Experience in SQL development.

Project Management or similar experience is a plus but not required.

Work Location: Quezon City, Eton Centris Building (We are currently working from home for now due to pandemic.)

Job Description
We are looking for a motivated and energetic product analyst to assist us in recommending the best products and launch strategies to increase company profitability. The Product Analyst responsibilities include working closely with different departments within the company, analyzing product data to make product recommendations, interviewing customers to receive customer feedback, and compiling product data. You should be able to study products on the market in order to create a better product.
To be successful as a Product Analyst, you should be able to monitor product performance on the market to meet or exceed sales forecasts. A top-performing Product Analyst is able to ensure that product costs remain within company budgets.
Product Analyst Responsibilities:
Evaluate the company products and compare them against industry trends.
Develop an understanding of company products to meet the company's current and future needs.
Provide assistance with product and rating reviews.
Develop and oversee small to medium scale projects.
Analyze metrics to continually improve company products.
Contribute to company operations, such as costing, inventory control, planning, and budgeting.
Assist the company in achieving short and long-term goals relating to product growth.
Work with other company departments to improve the analysis and presentation of products.
Product Analyst Requirements:
Bachelor??s Degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics or any related field.
Previous product analysis experience.
Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, Powerpoint) is preferred.
Proficient in database software.
Strong communication skills.
The ability to work under pressure and adapt to change.
The ability to balance customer needs against the company??s vision.
Excellent time management skills.

Job Description

What's in it for you?
 
Our Insights team has been collaboratively and individually recognized as leaders in the global communications evaluation industry. Due to our continued growth and success, we are looking for 1 Junior Research/Data Analyst  or Research/Data Analyst  to join our PH team. You will have the opportunity to:
Become part of a leading media intelligence team.
Have support from a great team of individuals who understand the media intelligence industry and always strive to improve.
Work with leading global brands.
Who are you?
A successful Junior Data /Research Analyst  or Research/Data Analyst has the ability to:
Scrutinize, analyze, organize media data whether news or social
Manage data from extraction down to visualization
Manage accounts based on agreed upon specifications and framework
Create visually appealing, consistent, and clean reports
He/she must:
Have a penchant for communications, public relations, news, and public opinion through social media
Have an eye for details
Have a strong commitment to data integrity and accuracy
Have an inherent interest in data visualization and data management techniques
Be able to work within a team but also strive to grow individually
The role:
Work under the guidance of the Research Manager as direct lead, Senior Research Manager, and Country Insights Lead to manage the daily schedule and plan for work optimization.
Ensure data management is completed with a high standard of quality based on the established measures.
Produce consistent output of data and reports with a high level of accuracy and in keeping with the account deadlines.
Provide support to the Insights Analysts and Researchers (in-house and outsource) in accessing, understanding, entering data and performing quality control checks.
Work on data visualization as per the established format of the reports but also go beyond the templates to ensure that the data presented are accurate and relevant.
Work on database and template maintenance as required.
Perform other duties as assigned by the Regional Insights Manager for Emerging Markets in Southeast Asia as direct vertical in the regional level with the goal of supporting the team.
 
Essentials:
Graduate in Communications Research, Mass Communications, Research, Statistics, Visual Communications, Communications Design, or any equivalent.
1-2 years of work experience as a researcher, analyst, or data visualizer OR a fresh graduate with the above-stated capabilities.
Professional command of the English language, both written and spoken
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications especially Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint (preferably with a working knowledge in using Power Pivot and Power BI), including Google Suite applications.
Strong analytical and data management skills (detail-oriented)
Ability to implement analysis projects
Strong interest in research and analytics
Must be willing to work in Ortigas
Must be able to start not later than November 23, 2020.
Desirables:
Proficient in using Advanced Microsoft Excel tools, including G-Suite
Data Analytics or Project management experience
Working knowledge of Adobe Illustrator, Tableau, or other visualization tools.
Personal Attributes:
Exceptionally self-motivated and directed
Patient and cordial but assertive
Ability to set and manage priorities judiciously
Ability to articulate ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences
Willing to learn and introduce new ideas
Recruitment process & Package:
Short-listed candidates will be required to undertake a diagnostics test on reading comprehension, grammar, excel skills test, and report visualization.
Candidates who aced the diagnostics tests will be invited for 1-2 interviews.
Regularization will be granted after successfully completing a 6 month probation period.
The role comes with a complete salary package, incentives, and HMO.

Detail oriented

Job Description:
Job Description
Temporary work-from-home setup due to COVID. Office is located in McKinley, Taguig.
Candidates must be flexible with shifts (24/7 contact centre operations, rotational shifts depending on the business need).
Role Overview
Global Forecasting & Reporting Analyst is responsible for supporting all contact centres by providing accurate and timely forecasts for staff planning. They will closely and continuously monitor factors that may impact contact/order/order volume to make ongoing refinements to forecast models to react to changes in the business. They will also be responsible for reporting on global KPI performance; develop and maintain the necessary processes to accurately report on headcount and seating to support global resource planning.

Key Responsibilities
Develop forecasts for contact/order volume for the various Lines of Businesses, Markets and Channels supported by the CARE Centers
On a quarterly basis to support staffing models
On an annual basis to support fiscal year staff budgeting
Conduct ad hoc forecast adjustments inter-quarter due to unforeseen changes (e.g. promotional calendar updates, customer behaviour changes)
Develop and/or enhance processes to drive improvements in the accuracy of forecasts and the timeliness of delivery of forecasting information to relevant stakeholders
Manage relationships with key stakeholders to obtain critical inputs for forecasting such as promotions, product launches, new self-service tools, adjusted operating hours, etc.
Produce forecast accuracy reporting and analysis to provide insight on root causes for forecast variance
Assess the impact of new initiatives on contact/order forecasts and make updates as needed to the forecast
Maintain WFM reporting cubes and dashboards in partnership with Analytics group
Analyze KPI performance data and provide insights into reasons for significant variances
Create and publish weekly, monthly and quarterly global KPI performance reports
Process ad-hoc requests for WFM data that is not readily available in existing reports
Provide WFM consultation support on relevant BI or Analytics projects
Define and maintain processes to ensure the accurate data capture of headcount across all Centers
Develops and maintains accurate reporting of headcount data across all Centers
Performs other duties as required based on WFM skillset
Qualifications/Requirements
Bachelor??s degree in Business with a focus on Statistics or Computer Science or related fields, or at least 5+ years solid Workforce Management Forecasting experience (senior specialist capacity).
Experience in working with various forecasting techniques and delivering quality control across forecasting and analysis activities to ensure continuous improvement
Working knowledge of contact center operational management & workforce management methodologies and principles.
Ability to manipulate large volumes of data using MS Excel and create useful reports
Experience using MS SQL is desired
Sound analytical thinking with strong problem solving and decision-making skills, with emphasis on drawing inferences from data and strong attention to detail
Exemplary communication and presentation skills with strong business acumen to facilitate different business relationships across multiple locations
Demonstrated success in a competitive, high-performance, target-driven environment
Experience with creating reporting dashboards is a plus
Must be available to work any shift that falls within our operating hours which spans 24 hours, seven (7) days per week

Job Description
Job Summary:
The Salesforce Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing and managing data within Salesforce that impacts global operation. This professional will work across multiple products, services and other teams to deliver prompt response to questions relating to operation implementations. The Data Analyst will analyze Salesforce data points for opportunities to accelerate the order backlog, coordinate communication with customers related to implementation, confirm month end activation and forecast, produce reporting on key performance metrics.
Responsibilities for this position include but are not limited to the following:
Proactively analyze backlog order data to identify opportunities to accelerate activations
Proactively manage forecast data across implementation teams to ensure accurate revenue is forecasted
Prepare operations reports for revenue, productivity and key performance metrics
Build Salesforce reports and dashboards as needed providing productivity, revenue and resource visibility
Demonstrate creativity, foresight and mature judgment in anticipating and solving complex problems
Create and maintain departmental documentation of all operational processes and procedures
Respond rapidly and accurately to internal and external customer requests delivered to high volume Inbox
Manage inquiries regarding order accuracy, scheduling status or resource assignments
Coordinate and advise management on resource assignments based on workload capacity reports
Collaborate with internal customers on projects to identify new business requirements that improve handoff processes
Identify and pursue continuous improvement of workflow processes to achieve maximum productivity
Assist with order completion and billing analysis required to deliver on audit requests
Maintain accurate records of all contact with external customers within Salesforce
REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES:
?? Bachelor??s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, any four-year course
?? With at least 3 years work experience in Data Analysis, Reporting, Dashboard Creation, Entry, and Audit.
?? Excellent English oral and written communication skills.
?? Customer Service Oriented.
?? Advanced analytical abilities to grasp the key points from complicated details
?? Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Excel including extensive use of Pivot Tables and formulas.
?? Strong knowledge of Visio or similar applications with ability to diagram complex flowcharts.
?? Advanced knowledge of Salesforce including ability to create dashboards and custom reports.
?? Strong organizational & time-management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks
?? Proven ability to work independently and to deliver results on time.
?? Ability to collaborate effectively with all level in the organization and across departments.
?? Must be able to effectively communicate with external customers and internal business partners.
?? Strong organizational, attention to detail and time-management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks.
?? A results-oriented individual who thrives working in a fast-paced environment.

Job Description
Do you crunch data for breakfast? Hungry for a data challenge? If yes, we want to talk to you. We are looking for data analysts with great talent and potential to join us! We are seeking experienced, energetic, and self-starting technologists to join the Data Cloud team. Our Data Cloud team is responsible for the our Identity Graph platform, which captures billions of behavioral, demographic, environmental, and transactional signals, for people-based marketing. As part of this team, the data analyst will be understanding how web behaviors correlate with user intent, building automated and detailed reporting systems and dashboards, and providing actionable insights for business strategy, product development and marketing operations.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
As a Senior Data Analyst, your responsibilities will include:
Interact with Prospect and Customer data to create impactful visualization and insight reports
Interact with potential partners to determine partnership value, data potential and go-forward plan
Understand our vast data sets and their main business uses and how to query them accurately
Identifying user segments from web traffic and user attribute data, and generate detailed performance reports for optimization
Owning a portion of the analytics request flow, prioritizing and responding to requests for insights from internal/external customers
Building and maintaining reports, dashboards, and metrics to further the maturity of our selfservice analytics capability
Optimizing queries and data flows on top of Snowflake/Hive/Athena/Vertica
Automating reports, dashboards and data flows
Understand the business objectives and provide recommendations on reports and insights to internal and external customers/partners
QUALIFICATIONS:
5+ years?? experience doing quantitative analysis, preferably for a consumer technology or digital media company
Experience using relational databases, very strong SQL skills
Knowledge of (or experience with) statistical packages for analyzing datasets (eg. R, Matlab/Octave, SciPy)
Data visualization and presentation skills, using tools like Looker or Tableau
Must be able to work at least 4 hours overlapping with Eastern Standard Time (9am-5pm)
Experience with large data sets and distributed computing (Snowflake/Hive/Hadoop/Spark) a plus
Experience with automating data workflows using Airflow, python a strong plus
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal direction
Foundational understanding of statistical analysis
Strong written and oral communication skills. Comfortable working with internal and external stakeholders
IDEAL CANDIDATE: Understand business objectives, able to pull together various analysis to support the decision makers accurately and expeditiously, add their own color, analysis and recommendations and optimize and automate the reporting

Job Description
Job Summary:
Workforce Analysts operate in a fast-paced environment. The position requires multitasking between analysis, real-time traffic monitoring and management reporting. Analysts will study call patterns and trend data to forecast call volume and calculate staffing requirements. They partner with Training and Operations Teams to schedule ongoing and periodic employee development sessions. Analysts are also involved in real-time monitoring of CMS and WFM tools to ensure service level agreements are met. Analysts will communicate significant changes or events to the Workforce Manager.
Role / Responsibilities:             
Responsible to follow daily change-management practices to accurately document absenteeism and events impacting Operations.             
Responsible to communicate effectively with management any significant protocol breaches and technical issues impacting center performance.             
Report center metrics hourly to management by email and significant events promptly by phone.             
Effectively communicate any operational problems or concerns to the Workforce Manager.             
Workforce Analysts are responsible for training Operations Teams on use of WFM client applications and fielding questions from Team Leaders.             
Utilizing skills in MS Office suite applications, WFM applications and other contact center tools to perform daily responsibilities and complete projects.             
Providing custom reporting to the Operations Manager to drive center KPIs and uncover call-avoidance issues.             
Researching attendance and performance issues for HR and Operations Manager when required.             
             
Required Skills / Qualifications / Knowledge / Experience:             
High School Diploma             
At least one year of experience in fast-paced contact-center environment             
Strong analytical and communications skills.             
Intermediate capabilities in MS Office suite applications.             
Ability to work extended hours when needed; consistent non-traditional hours required             
Advanced capabilities in MS Office suite applications             
Demonstrated English proficiency both verbally and written             
Experience in Finance/Accountancy is a plus             
Flexibility to work overtime and on weekends

Your key accountabilities will include:
?? Developing sustainable data solutions and strategies that are commercial, well managed, apply proactive governance and support the objectives of ANZ Learning Delivery Services
?? Developing tools and methods that make best use of the inherent value within People/HR data
?? Sourcing data from a variety of sources, combining HR/People data with other available internal and external data sources, to tell an integrated story
?? Exploring opportunities for more sophisticated analytics and insights, shifting the maturity of analytics within ANZ Learning Delivery Services
?? Performing data analysis within ANZ Learning Delivery Services in order to identify opportunities to improve the employee experience and deliver business value
?? Leveraging descriptive analytics to present business insights to design, implement and measure successful business interventions
?? Developing custom reports to assist with complex data analysis
?? Generating data extracts using standard published reports with applicable filters as requested
?? Setting-up subscription reporting (standard and ad-hoc) for stakeholders
?? Identifying opportunities to continually standardize, streamline, improve and automate learning administrative processes
?? Ensuring risks and issues are identified, managed and escalated appropriately
?? Governing and monitoring of Learning related HP/People data to ensure integrity and accuracy
?? Working with ANZ??s Data Governance team to ensure the ethical use of our HR/People data
Skills, Knowledge & experience
?? Data-driven decision making
?? Systems thinking
?? Consulting skills
?? Business and commercial acumen
?? Storytelling
?? Influencing and relationship building
?? Data visualisation
?? Descriptive and diagnostic analytics
?? Data ethics
?? Effective Data wrangling skills
?? Demonstrated ability to perform structured queries
?? Data analytics experience, with an ability to produce custom reports
?? Attention to detail and ability to follow and make recommended changes to operational processes (including automation opportunities) and governance frameworks
?? Excellent organizational, planning, customer service and presentation skills
?? Excellent written and oral communication skills
?? Ability to build strong relationships with team members; and service users
?? Learning/HR experience (desirable)
ANZ??s purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. Our people are proud to help people achieve incredible things ?? be it buying their home, building a business or saving for things big or small.

ANZ??s HR function, known as Talent & Culture (T&C), brings our purpose to life by working with our people to solve the problems of today, and equipping them with skills and experiences to adapt to the challenges of the future. To do this, we??ve embraced agile ways of working as we focus on delivering better end-to-end experiences for our people.

Our work to build a diverse and inclusive workforce and stronger connection with the community has been recognised by different organizations but this is only the beginning for us. Our T&C people look at the big picture, without dismissing the details, and challenge the status quo to drive positive change.

This is an exciting time at ANZ, we are changing and innovating.  Be an agent of change in the recruiting world, apply today!

Job Description:
Job Description
Duty 1: MRA & Project Support

Data Gathering
- Extracts/generates quantitative information from a single or multiple tools (Business Intelligence Tools - ie: Tableau, SQL, etc) and/or from databases using standard queries
- Communicates with resource person to get input/raw data needed for report generation
- Conducts research to gather qualitative information (market need, market size, ethnography, competitive product information, industry trends, and check product specifications) from internal & external sources that will be used for analysis

Data Manipulation
- Cleans extracted data using pre-defined guidelines or instructions
- Formats extracted data based on expected report output (with batching capability and multiple data formatting requirements)
- Calculates data using available fields within the gathered information (basic math and statistics)
- Categorizes and segments extracted data using tools to convert data to information relevant to the report (excel, macro, database)
- Consolidates and combines extracted data from multiple resources using automated tools (excel, macro, database), and/or from different system tools in one single database using queries (SQL, Tableau) standardize data structure from different data sources

Data Analysis
- Gathers and analyzes report requirements from stakeholders. Identify and provide solution to general inquiries
- Analyses gathered information & data using descriptive analytics (basic mathematics & comparative analysis), diagnostic analytics (root cause analysis, gap analysis), predictive and prescriptive analytics (data interpretation, data correlation & statistics)
- Analyzes stakeholder requirements from an existing report and provides improvement and recommendation based on customer request
- Evaluates objective/charter and recommends non-standard reports/ workaround based on customer requirement and/or gathered data and analysis

Reporting
- Creates reports based on standard templates and and/or tests dynamic reports based on the designed format
- Conceptualizes report design contents and methodologies based from gathered data and/or analysis for static or dynamic reports
- Provide report recommendations and validate with stakeholders

Administration
- Logs/Enters incidents to appropriate tool (JIRA, Web Request Form, Sharepoint, Teams)
- Tracks and logs customer issues

Continuous Process & Innovation
- Identifies continuous improvement project ideas
- Records and reviews/assesses the improvement/innovation raised by the business unit
- Escalates specific issues and provides recommendation to customers to address them. Works closely with counterparts/POCs to identify loopholes and process gaps

Project Initiation
- Attends scope reviews to learn what the project request is all about
- Assists project manager in gathering, analyzing and clarifying customer requirements; uses technical knowledge to gauge complexity of the request

Project Planning
- Performs research and analysis to validate if the detailed solution is the best fit to meet the requirements
- Creates prototypes, mock-ups using standard project templates and tools for projects without wireframes
- Provides own work estimates and can negotiate turnaround time within the team
- Informs the project lead on changes
- Creates project scope and timeline for dashboards. In case of differences, negotiate with clients for dashboards
- Reviews and assesses prototypes in terms of relevance and application to the requirements of the customers
- Analyzes risk and mitigate project circumstances base on impact assessment
- Recommends and negotiates solution and development timeline to the stakeholders; gets their buy-in and commitment to any deliverable

Project Execution
- Writes code based on specifications defined (ie frontend and backend); Participates in cross-functional testing and peer reviews
- Follows set coding standards, code sharing and design
guidelines of the team
- Shares only working codes with the teams.
- Reports own progress back to the project tracking tool

Project Testing and Deployment
- Sets up UAT (informing participants, scheduling, gathering results)
- Implements the necessary fix or improvement for basic functionalities based on the UAT results
- Creates user manuals using standard templates of the team
- Creates test cases, finalizes and/or approves to be used during UAT
- Finalizes and approves the test cases to be used during UAT
- Reviews the objective in comparison to the actual output
- Create, recommends and seek approval for UAT plan (data back-up/migration, communication, cut-offs, code freeze, production server setup)

Vendor Support
- Monitors the progress of the issues based on the timeline
- Monitors the progress of 3rd party suppliers, coordinates with stakeholders if there are issues and concerns
- Assesses/Rates contractors' performance based on specified criteria

Implementation
- Performs import/export of records and/or data for validation
- Create workbooks/ dashboards, modify metadata, and finally publish a completed workbook or data source to Tableau Server

Duty 2: System Support and Maintenance

System Maintenance
- Implements the basic change request (dashboard enhancements, data source modifications)
- Implements the minor and/or major change request (dashboard enhancements, data source modifications)
- Recommends improvement on change request and processes

Database Maintenance
- Troubleshoots and fixes minor problems with the tool such as --- minor UI changes, typo errors, simple coding errors

Project Maintenance
- Troubleshoots minor and/or major bugs/defects and assists stakeholders in making sure issues/requests are resolved appropriately and on time (minor: UI fixes, raw data requests; advanced bug/defects: loss of data, server errors, logical errors, unexpected app behavior)

Maintenance & Upgrades
- Encodes new features or changes related to the system upgrade
- Creates and Sends maintenance announcements to end-users
- Monitors data transfer and load processes
- Monitors errors and data inconsistencies
- Controlling permissions for system contents such as data sources, workbooks, and views for data security.
- Gathers approval and validates completeness of the requirements
- Provides basic technical support on issues such as user contact, issue triage, user follow-up and communication
- Interprets BU/ Platform/ WA report requirements and cascade to action owner
- Maintains existing system functionality and capacity as needed based on identified issues and improvements
- Validates new features thru testing
- Troubleshoots business systems/web issues and relays them to other world areas and IT
- Propose and Implement Preventive action to avoid issue recurrence

Duty 4: Operations Support

Documented Information Management
- Creates technical documentation/user manual, data dictionary, database schema, etc.)
- Updates an existing Documented Information related documents and processes (e.g. procedures, forms, templates, manuals, articles, external documented information, etc.) based on the documentation guidelines (e.g. identification, description, format)
- Maintains the master list of documented information (e.g. procedures, forms, templates, manuals, articles, external documented information, etc.) for completeness and accuracy
- Identifies and controls the storage, retention, preservation and disposal of documented information.
- Create a new Documented Information related documents and processes (e.g. procedures, forms, templates, manuals, articles, external documented information, etc.) based on the documentation guidelines (e.g. identification, description, format)

Training & Development
- Conducts basic and/or intermediate and comprehensive overview and awareness training on products, processes and/or business tools

Education: University degree (Computer Science, Computer Engineering,
Information Technology, Information Systems or similar)

Job Related Experience: At least (2.5) two and a half years' relevant work
experience in the IT Business Systems processes with relevant experience in
data mining, manipulation, analysis and reporting

Specific Knowledge:

- Microsoft Office

- Data Manipulation &
Interpretation

- Database management/maintenance

- Root Cause / Gap Analysis

- Project Management

Skills:

- Advanced Microsoft Excel
proficiency Level 3 - Advanced Formulas, Pivot Tables & VBA Macro

- Oral and written
communication Skills

- Problem Solving &
Analytical Skills

- Presentation Skills

- Training Skills

- Project Management Skills

- Data Storytelling

- SQL Queries

- PowerBI or other similar tools

Job Description:
Job Highlights
Perfect work-life balance
Great company culture
